title: Shopify Frontend Developer
description:
Job Description
About Seed
We’re a Shopify Plus development agency based in Irvine, ca. We work on fast-paced e-commerce projects for a wide range of clients. We work with brands like Kith NYC, LRG, Neff, Crunchyroll, R13, TeeFury, Razor, Fanjoy, Qalo, Spiritual Gangster, and more…
About The Position
You'll be working on implementing design mock-ups into Shopify's templating system. You'll be the primary developer on each job assigned to you, you'll work with the designer to make sure the design is implemented pixel perfect. You'll be working in a very fast-paced environment, building several sites per month as well as daily maintenance of current client websites. You'll need to be very organized, not afraid to ask questions, and willing to learn.
Skills we're looking for:
JavascriptHTMLCSS/SCSSLiquidReact or Vue.jsNode.jsjQueryMobile responsive codingAttention to detail
Bonus Skills:
eCommerceShopify
company_about:
We are Southern California's most experienced Shopify and Shopify Plus web development experts that are helping businesses across the nation grow. Based out of Irvine in Orange County, we love what we do and will work hard to help grow your business.

Longtime Shopify Experts, we have 4+ years of experience on the Shopify and Shopify Plus platform, we are well versed and experienced on every aspect of the platform.

All of our development and design is done here, in Sunny Southern California. No outsourcing overseas, ever.

Customized services are our specialty. Here are some of our capabilities:

• Custom Shopify themes
• Theme modification
• Custom-built apps
• Rebranding
• Email marketing integration
• Social media page design and integration
• Copywriting
• PSD to theme conversion
• Shopify Plus Scripts

Not sure what you need? Shoot us an email at sanjay@seedcms.com with your questions. We'll be sure to respond to you within 24 hours.

Take comfort in the fact that no project is too small or too big for us. We are here to help you grow!

Our Shopify APPS
https://apps.shopify.com/look-books
https://apps.shopify.com/pressify
https://apps.shopify.com/crowd-visibility-funding-tracker

Designers & Agencies
If you're in need of a developer partner feel free to contact us, we do many PSD to liquid theme conversions. We'll turn your designs into a functional Shopify store.

title: Infotainment User Experience Engineer
description:
Location: Raymond, OH
What Makes a Honda, Is Who Makes a Honda
Honda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one.We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals.
At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success.We strive to be a company which serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.”
We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team.
If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future!
About This Position
As an Infotainment UX Engineer you will conduct and utilize existing research to define and develop Infotainment solutions, features, and designs that satisfy customer needs and maintain competitiveness with the utmost quality.
At this career level, you are in charge of delivering defined UX assignments with guidance, while expanding the breadth of your technical knowledge.
Responsibilities Include
 Research and report the user experience of current and future products, both in automotive and consumer electronics space. Analyze user research data to understand customers; needs and desires for infotainment systems (displays, information, interface, entertainment, features, controls, etc.). Correlate and propose modifications to and/or new Infotainment solutions within assigned area of responsibility. Create feature and user interface specifications, under the guidance of more experienced engineers. Verify the correct implementation of specifications within assigned area of responsibility on test setups and vehicles.
Who We Are Seeking
 Required Education: 
 Bachelors in Human Factors, Industrial Design, UX design, Engineering, Psychology or Product Development
Desired Skills
 Experience conducting user-centered research in educational and/or professional environment Product Benchmarking Experience with GUI prototyping preferred (Axure, Kanzi, etc) Excellent communication skills and ability to produce presentation documents.
Additional Position Factors
 Working Environment – Partial remote work, Partial onsite work, minimal travel (<5%). Physical requirements – Majority of responsibilities require working at a computer or attending meetings in an office/test lab/remote environment. Some responsibilities require driving vehicle and outfitting vehicles with test equipment and/or replacing infotainment components. OT as needed to meet project deliverables – typical 0-15%.
At Honda, you will play a key role in our journey to become a company that society wants to exist now, and in the future. Your endless curiosity will drive innovation and your courageous spirit will challenge the status quo.We believe having a workforce made up of diverse thinkers and innovators makes us a better Honda. Respect for each other and respect for diversity each and every day drives our associates to contribute at the highest level and work effectively in a team environment. We make the dream of mobility a reality with our innovative and high-quality products. Together, we Bring the Future to our customers, associates, and communities.We are Honda!

 What differentiates Honda and make us an employer of choice? 

Total Rewards
 Competitive base salary Annual Bonus Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, personal days 401K Plan with company match + additional contribution Relocation assistance (if eligible)
Career Growth
 Advancement opportunities Career mobility Education reimbursement for continued learning Training and Development programs
Additional Offerings
 Wellbeing program Community service and engagement programs Product programs Free drinks onsite
Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.
company_about:
Since 1979, Honda of America Manufacturing has been committed to building quality products for our customers and quality communities where our associates live and work. 

Based upon a philosophy of respecting each individual, we have built a culture of involvement and creativity that harnesses the collective power of each and every team member.

To learn more about who we are and how we operate, we invite you to take a trip through our web site (www.ohio.honda.com) to learn what makes us Honda.

title: Jr. Software Developer - MMASW - Austin
description:
Title: Junior Software Developer, iNGAGED
FLSA: Exempt
Job Type: Full-time
Description:
Marsh McLennan Agency (MMA) provides business insurance, employee health & benefits, retirement, and private client insurance solutions to organizations and individuals seeking limitless possibilities. With 9,000 colleagues and 160 offices across North America, we combine the personalized service model of a local consultant with the global resources of the world’s leading professional services firm, Marsh McLennan.
MMA offers a variety of technology solutions to help our clients mitigate and manage risk. Senior Developer will be responsible creating a quality application to solve complex business problems. This position requires mentorship of junior development staff and performing code reviews.
Job Responsibilities:
Write advanced programming code for both front-end and back-end projectsEnhance the security in our backend environment in conjunction with automated scansMaintain, modify, and scale our AWS environment in conjunction with the external security team.Analyze the behavior of our applications to find and fix bugs.Analyze performance of our applications and determine efficienciesCollaborate with other developers during working sessionsProvide mentoring and best coding practices to other staffPerform code reviewsEffectively communicate with other functions to develop outstanding products and services for our end customers.
Requirements:
4 years’ experience in all aspects of software developmentCS in Computer Science or equivalent education and experienceExcellent knowledge of front-end web JavaScript frameworks such as ember.js, Angular and ReactExcellent knowledge of back-end programming languages such as goExperience creating and maintaining databasesExperience with PostgreSQL and MySQL databases a plusGood interpersonal skills
We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. Marsh & McLennan Agency offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: health and welfare, tuition assistance, 401K, employee assistance program, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at:  http://marshmma.com/careers .
company_about: Marsh McLennan Agency (MMA) provides business insurance, employee health & benefits, retirement, and private client insurance solutions to organizations and individuals seeking limitless possibilities. With over 9,000 colleagues and 160 offices across the United States and Canada, MMA combines the personalized service model of a local consultant with the global resources and expertise of the world’s leading professional services firm, Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC). MMA generates more than $2 billion in annualized revenue, making it one of the largest brokerage operations in North America.

title: Software Developer, Frontend
description:
The Team You’ll Be Joining

Forum was started from a place of helpfulness, with the mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible and successful for early-stage founders. That extends to the people we work with. When you work with Forum, you’re working with a respectful, inclusive team that you can trust, ready to collaborate and support you at any given moment.

We are unapologetically ourselves, self-aware, and act with complete honesty and integrity. We’re open to learning, to different and new ideas, to feedback, and are constantly looking to improve. We work hard and smart, and spend much of our time feeling challenged and inspired by each other.

The Role

We’re looking for a software developer to work with our team of authentic, ambitious, smart, nice people to help us build the next generation of great venture-backed startups. You will have the unique opportunity to be an individual contributor in early MVP building for new startups, rapidly prototype innovative software interfaces, and partner with startup CEOs and the Studio team to build B2B software products - end to end.

What You’ll Be Doing:
Collaborate closely with the Studio team and Founders to build delightful user experiencesCreate reusable, effective, and performant front-end components for our design system and component library.Develop clean, scalable, and easily maintained codeWork with modern languages, frameworks, and tools to build performant products 

What We're Looking For:
You've shipped non-trivial SaaS products that have delighted users, perhaps some from the ground upYou've demonstrated strong empathy not just as a software developer, but also in how you work and collaborate with othersYou're adept with frontend technologies and are open to jumping in with mentorship in other areas You can make wise choices and take smart risks when dealing with ambiguous requirements. Once you have context, you can figure out how to solve problems on your own.

Tech Stack:
JavaScript (React)Node.js (both for web development and microservices)Python for Data and AI/MLServerless Deployment (using Serverless.com framework and AWS Lambda)Github Workflow or other similar CI/CD pipelines.

What We Offer:
A front-row seat to venture building. Maybe you aspire to building your own venture down the road, or are just really excited to build in the early days. We're building world-class B2B SaaS products with incredible founders from the ground upThe opportunity to participate in team gatherings and offsites to collaborate and celebrate in-personThe equipment and resources you'll need to be set up for success working remotelyA remote-first environment; we do have offices in Toronto and New York if you happen to be within commuting distance

Compensation & Benefits:
The salary range for candidates in Canada is 120,000-130,000 CADThe salary range for candidates in Tulsa is 100,000-110,000 USDFund Carry - a direct share in the financial success of the Studio ventures we build togetherA generous benefits package including a healthcare spending accountUnlimited vacation policyFinal offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed above

About Forum:

Forum Ventures is an early-stage fund, accelerator, and community designed to take founders from pre-seed to seed. We back companies across all B2B SaaS verticals with a monetary investment, a dedicated support team, hand picked mentors and a growing community of founders, operators, and investors.

We join founders early on in their journey - usually as the first check in - and we stay by their side as they build, navigate the ups and downs, and go on to do great things. We’re a community of B2B SaaS experts, founders and operators here to support founders every step of the way.

Forum founders have gone on to raise from funds like Andreessen Horowitz, NEA, Uncork Capital, 8VC, Founders Fund, Menlo Ventures, Canaan, Bowery Capital, Susa Ventures, SV Angel, and more.

Forum recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status' as required by applicable law.

Forum’s dedication to promoting diversity, multiculturalism, equity and inclusion is more than a commitment- it is the foundation of what we do. And thus we strongly encourage people from ALL backgrounds to apply to this position
company_about:
Forum Ventures is the leading early-stage fund, program and community for B2B SaaS startups. Founded in 2014 as Acceleprise, we’re on a mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible and successful for early-stage founders, through pre-seed and seed-stage funding, high touch programming, corporate perks and introductions, and an active SaaS community. 

Forum For Founders, our pre-seed program, provides founders with $100k in funding and 15 intense weeks of talks, events, mentorship and 1:1 guidance focused on go to market and fundraising. Forum Seed, our seed fund, backs exceptional SaaS startups at the seed-stage both from within and outside of our pre-seed program. 

With over 250 portfolio companies, Forum founders have gone on to raise from NEA, Andreessen Horowitz, Uncork Capital, 8VC, Founders Fund, Menlo Ventures, Canaan, Bowery Capital, Susa Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, SV Angel, True Ventures and many more.

Our private peer community for Innovation executives -- The Innovation Forum -- brings together like-minded intrapreneurs from all backgrounds to share best practices, insights, and advice, and support one another. In addition to our incredible peer community, members get access to industry trend reports, collaborative events, emerging technology, and startup introductions.

Learn more at www.forumvc.com

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Award winning eCommerce agency with great staff retention.Varied project work with exposure to the latest technologies including React.Option to be highly remote with 1 trip a month to their office in Bath.
We’re working with a highly regarded eCommerce agency based in Bath to help them find a Frontend Developer to join their team.
Their services include new builds design app creation site takeovers and more; elevating the growth of some iconic brands and helping them to stand out from the crowd. They work with big names across fashion gifts homeware sports food and drink to name a few.
This is a highly remote role that will involve 1 trip per month to their office for key team meetings. Of course if you wanted to be office based more often you have the option to do so as much as you wish.
What You’ll Be Doing
Reporting into the Head of Development and working alongside a cross-functional pod that includes 4-5 developers designers and project manager you work on a varied remit of projects including greenfield development work.
This is a collaborative role where you’ll work directly with clients to support with project estimation working with a mix of tech including HTML CSS JavaScript as well as template theming in Shopify to build beautiful eCommerce sites for some amazing household big name brands.
You’ll also be able to get involved in app development and be exposed to modern tech including TypeScript and React.
The Skills We’re Looking For
Commercial coding experience in HTML CSS and JavaScript.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Comfortable in a client facing environment.Ability to support with project estimation.Knowledge of TypeScript and/or React would be beneficial.Prior experience in an eCommerce environment is highly desirable.Any exposure to Shopify Liquid Templating would be an advantage.
What You’ll Get In Return For Your Skills
A salary of up to £60000 plus an annual company bonus. Some of their benefits include the option to work remotely with only one trip a month into their office in Bath choice of whatever equipment you prefer ongoing learning and development paid training conferences workshops etc 23 days holiday plus bank holidays and an additional weeks’ paid leave over the festive period a range of staff discounts and incentives and more.
 What’s next?
Apply with your CV or get in touch with Becca to find out more.

title: Web Designer
description:
Job Description
Job Summary: 
CTech Manufacturing is seeking a Web Designer who is energetic and well-rounded in all facets of web design. If you want an exciting career in a marketing role where your ideas can help lay the groundwork for continued success, this is a fantastic opportunity with a great company. 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Design, maintain, and code the look and feel of responsive pages on the website. Deliver improvements and optimizations to existing features. Be a strong advocate for excellent user experience and recommend solutions. Create wireframes, prototypes, and mockups for new features for the website. Create usability and A/B tests to make data-driven decisions. Create solution-oriented designs based on customer and industry type for our B2C and B2B customers. Work with internal teams to identify and develop customer journeys and roadmaps. Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to gain additional insights. Stay current on UI and UX trends to drive new innovative and creative ideas. Identify and improve areas of the website with SEO-rich content. Apply and maintain all branding and styling guidelines. Inspect and evaluate all finished products before they "Go Live" on the website and after. Acts as a backup to other areas of marketing. Meet established deadlines for assigned projects and proactively inform stakeholders of project status and updates. 
Qualifications And Skills
Required:
3+ years of actual web design experience. Strong knowledge of web development: HTML and CSS. Experience with design as it relates to both UI and UX. Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud products. Familiarity with CRM and DAM platforms. Excellent communication skills and ability to draw meaningful conclusions. Some travel required (5%-10%)
Preference will be given to candidates with experience in any of the following areas:
SEO/SEMWeb MerchandisingCopywriting Quality Assurance Testing
company_about:
With a passion for racing,  Jim Greenheck needed a quality mobile storage solution when on the road with his drag car. Jim sought after his own design and built the first CTech cabinet. He took into consideration “MOBILE APPLICATION” when engineering the first CTech products and that still holds true to this day.	

CTech products were developed to be lighter, stronger, and of a higher quality than what was available. With new innovations to our products over time, the base framework for the mobile application has stayed the same allowing CTech to gain the reputation of being the most respected storage solution in the market. 

We now offer all aluminum carts, cabinets, drawers, and tactical cabinets which cover several different industries. Our products are used in a variety of mobile and stationary applications.

CTECH stays engaged with customers to deliver new and innovative solutions every day. From major race teams to global energy companies, our people, technology, and engineering practices allow us to continue this trend of innovation.

title: IT Jr. Developer/User Support
description:
Fulfill your purpose at CLM: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8bCS3JufXrPyr7SgiLrusQ

Summary Statement

Center for Life Management (CLM) provides the area's most comprehensive array of outpatient mental healthcare. We offer innovative and evidence-based services that enhance the health and well-being of individuals and families. We partner with local and state-wide organizations to achieve our mission and together build stronger communities and greater awareness for whole health and wellness.

Working as an integral member of the Information Technology (IT) Department, the IT Jr. Developer and User Support staff is responsible for assisting with developing an efficient and robust IT environment, evaluating support issues with regards to those systems and resolving or escalating requests to more senior members of the IT team. This is a full time, 40 hour per week entry level developer position.

Major Functional Areas and Description of Duties
Assisting with developing an efficient and robust IT environment, evaluating support issues with regards to those systems, providing exceptional user-support, and escalate requests to more senior members of the IT team;Assist with ongoing evaluation, repair and improvement of existing programs and systems;Support efforts for IT system development;Realize assigned objectives associated with coverage for other IT staff in the event primary is unavailable; Demonstrate collaborative involvement in planning and operations; Responsible for reporting work targeting automating reporting, improving efficiencies in generation, validation, and distribution of reports, as well as communicating and responding to reporting concerns;Complete other assigned duties and responsibilities consistent with knowledge, skills, and abilities;Represent CLM in a professional and appropriate manner in all settings;Perform all duties and responsibilities identified or assigned by supervisor in accordance with CLM & ITS departmental policies and procedures.
Qualifications and Skills Trade school, college or related experienced in information services/programming training;Preference provided to those with prior web application development experience;Proficient computer skills and solid understanding of Microsoft products (Office 365), HTML, relational databases;Basic understanding of hardware, operating systems, applications, and networks;Strong interpersonal skills with ability to effectively communicate, both orally and written, technical information to others;Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to manage competing projects while adhering to deadlines;Ability and desire to work as part of a team while also able to be self-directed and motivated in work;Ability to acquire and effectively execute new skills as needed according to evolving department needs.
Physical Demands and Working Conditions

The majority of the work takes place in an office setting with occasional work required in other CLM settings. Manual dexterity is needed to use computers and standard office equipment. The ability to sit for extended periods of time is required. Reliable internet access, transportation, a clean driving record, and proof of auto insurance coverage are required.

Benefits

At Center for Life Management we offer a robust benefits package because caring for our staff is just as important as caring for our clients. Benefits for benefits eligible employees include:
Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision)Health Reimbursement Arrangement Flexible Spending AccountPaid earned time (3 weeks in year one, caps at 6 weeks with tenure) Paid holidays (8) with bonus birthday holiday in your birth month403(b) Retirement Savings Plan with 3% company contribution upon 1 year of employmentLife Insurance paid by companyShort and Long Term Disability paid by companyAccidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance paid by companyEmployee Assistance Program (EAP), accessible to staff and their natural supportsCompany issued cell phone and laptop as needed for roleScholarship for professional advancementMileage reimbursement for applicable positionsOn the job training and continuing education opportunitiesRewarding and supportive work environment with excellent opportunities for career growth Meaningful relationships with your co-workers and the individuals we serve Flexible work scheduleTeamwork, teamwork and more teamwork!
company_about:
MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES

CLM provides a comprehensive complement of mental health and substance use services, psychiatric treatment, acute care, medication services, emergency intervention, and family support services for adults, children, adolescents and families. In addition, we work closely with a variety of regional health and human service providers to ensure that your mental health care is comprehensive, integrated and community-based.

title: Front-End Associate
description:
Company Overview
Founded in 1929, Heinen's is a premier grocery store chain noted for its quality products and outstanding customer service. Heinen's has now welcomed the fourth generation into the family-owned business, which operates 23 stores (19 in Cleveland, Ohio and 4 in Chicago, Illinois), two distribution warehouses, one food production plant, and a corporate office. Culturally, we place a heavy emphasis on quality of life for every associate within the organization. We offer this through a competitive compensation package, professional development and leadership opportunities, paid time off, and balanced work schedules.
Retail Professional - Heinen's Diamond Difference Standards
As an associate of Heinen's there are key components to learn, implement and master. Each of these are integral to the Heinen's Brand and to your success. These are simple behaviors that help distinguish us as the premier supermarket in Northeast Ohio and Chicago.
Professional Appearance - Ensure you present yourself, your team, your products and your department in support of our Brand.
Acknowledge - Acknowledge customers with a smile and eye contact.
Evaluate - Develop the habit of evaluating store conditions on a continuous basis using our 5-Step QCSSS (Quality, Cleanliness, Stock Levels, Signage, and Serviceable) for excellence.
Thank - Thank each other for a job well done to reinforce positive behaviors and attitudes to support your team.
Engage - Engage customers when appropriate.
Responsibilities
Operate scanners, scales, cash registers and other electronics.Accept payments, ensuring all prices and quantities are accurate.Follow all store procedures regarding coupons, gift cards or the purchase of specific items, such as alcohol.Follow company standards for proper packing.Acquire and share knowledge of the store.Prioritize daily work based on varying business needs.Attend required corporate meetings and training classes.Comply with all personal and food safety company standards.Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.Possess a sense of urgency and the ability to work independently to achieve daily tasks.Comply with all company policies and standards.Possess the ability to work with minimal supervision.Be production driven with the ability to work continuously on repetitive tasks, while standing.Possess the ability to frequent lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.Be able to work in various weather conditions.Must be willing to work the amount of hours required to meet company objectives, with the understanding that occasionally business needs will require additional time.Must be willing to work the non-traditional five day work schedule, including Saturday, Sunday and evenings.
Heinen's, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Culturally, we place a heavy emphasis on quality of life for every associate within the organization.  We offer this through a competitive compensation package, professional development and leadership opportunities, paid time off, and balanced work schedules.

title: Front End Developer
description:
ContinuumCloud is seeking a talented and passionate Front - End Developer to join our team. As a Front-End Developer at ContinuumCloud, you will have the opportunity to be a part of a dynamic team where you can make a significant impact on the lives of others through innovative software solutions. If you are passionate about front-end development, user experience, and making a positive difference, apply now!
Who We Are:
ContinuumCloud offers a spectrum of cloud-based software solutions intentionally designed to meet the unique needs of the behavioral health and human services industry. These solutions include an EHR platform, powered by Welligent, an HR & Payroll system, powered by DATIS HR Cloud, as well as a Patient Engagement Platform, powered by CaredFor. Through these offerings, ContinuumCloud empowers organizations to provide high-quality care and deliver on their mission.
Requirements
How you’ll make an impact:
Collaborate with the development team to implement and maintain front-end features of Patient Engagement platform CaredFor Utilize Angular, TypeScript, and Ionic to build responsive and user-friendly web and mobile applications Work with development team to translate mocks and wireframes into functional and visually appealing user interfaces Reference existing pages and styles within our platform to maintain consistency and improve user experience Contribute to UI/UX discussions and provide valuable input to enhance the overall usability of our software Participate in sprint ceremonies, including refinement and retrospective meetingsAssist in PHP (Laravel) development and API integration for full-stack functionality Employ CSS styling to enhance the visual appeal and user experience of our applications Utilize Ionic to contribute to the development of our cross-platform mobile app Other duties as assigned
What you bring to the role:
Proven experience as a Front End Developer with expertise in Angular, TypeScript and Ionic ( Ionic preferred but open to React Native experience as well)Strong understanding of responsive web design principles and mobile-first development Ability to be resourceful and creative for continuous UI/UX enhancement and ideas Experience with Ionic or similar for cross-platform mobile app development Familiarity with PHP and Laravel for development preferred Proficiency in CSS for styling and design enhancements preferredStrong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Adept at translating design concepts into functional, intuitive, and visually appealing user interfaces Demonstrated problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset to suggest improvements and solutions 
Benefits
Benefits and Advantages: 
We care about the health and well-being of our team. We provide a comprehensive benefits package including:
Multiple medical insurance options including a 100% employer-paid plan 401k plan with company match Company-funded Life, AD&D, and Disability Insurances Company-sponsored training and certification programs Open PTO program Company holidays include New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, the Friday after Thanksgiving, Christmas Day, and 2 Floating Holidays Parental Leave Perks in our offices include paid parking, an on-site gym, catered lunches, and healthy snacks 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Software Development Intern
description:
Are you looking for tech industry experience in an innovative company? Come join 24G's internship program and learn what it is like to work in an agency environment. 24G is an area leader in creating software and digital solutions for some of the world’s biggest brands. Our team of programmers, designers, and creators design websites, build apps, and more—all from the comfort of our innovative open-office space located in a decommissioned bowling alley. (Score!)
We’re looking for intern developers to join our team. You will have opportunities to use the newest technologies and techniques to develop applications for a diverse array of clients. No degree required!
But most importantly, we are looking for passionate developers that are eager to grow. If you want to expand your skills in a multitude of areas, if you work well on a team, and enjoy building projects from start to finish, then this is the role for you.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Job Description
Job Summary
As a Software Engineer I, you are part of an agile team that works to enhance, design, and deliver the software components to the firm's state-of-the-art technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. As an entry-level member of a software engineering team, you execute basic software solutions through the design, development, and troubleshooting of a single technical area within a business function, while gaining skills and experience to grow within your role.
Job Responsibilities
Executes basic software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting
Writes secure and high-quality code using the syntax of at least one programming language with peer guidance
Interprets architecture and design representations as well as nonfunctional requirements to develop secure, stable software against a defined architecture
Actively applies automation to reduce manual toil in the Software Development Life Cycle
Addresses basic code quality issues
Gathers, analyzes and synthesizes basic data sets in service of technical troubleshooting and generating insights to drive continuous improvements
Breaks down routine technical tasks to troubleshoot and solve issues
Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills
Baseline knowledge of software, applications and technical processes within a given technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, Android, etc.)
Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, with a passion to build an inclusive and innovative culture
Demonstratable ability to code in one or more languages
Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement
Proficiency in developmental toolsets
Basic knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices
Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills
Exposure to cloud technologies

title: Assistant Front End Manager
description:
Job Description
Our primary focus is to create an uplifting customer experience through exceptional service. We are looking for friendly and engaged people who have a passion to serve and Feed the Human Spirit. Our associates work in different departments in our stores but share a common goal of being friendly and caring to each other and our customers. From making it right to making connections, we show each other how much we truly care.
As a part of our team, you could:
Assist customers at checkout and bag groceriesBuild attractive displays and stock shelvesSelect and gather products to fulfill customer’s online ordersPrepare gourmet dishes, make artisan sandwiches and serve local and imported cheesesBake fresh breads and cookies, decorate cakes and serve personalized coffeesCreate artistic floral arrangementsPrepare fresh cut fruits and vegetablesCut and serve the highest quality meats and seafoodContribute in many other areas to provide extraordinary service to our customers
We are now accepting applications for all management positions including front end, bakery, deli, produce, meat, and grocery
We offer our associates much more than just a paycheck, we offer a career with promise. In addition to medical and retirement plans, we offer paid vacation, life insurance, tuition assistance and college scholarships. Many associates who begin in part-time jobs choose to grow with us into long-term careers. If you are interested in becoming a valued member of our team, apply now at Jobs.FrysFood.com. We look forward to getting to know you!
company_about:
Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, The Kroger Co. is one of the largest retailers in the United States based on annual sales, holding the #22 ranking on the Fortune 100 list. Kroger was founded in 1883 and incorporated in 1902. Kroger operates 2,481 supermarkets, In addition to supermarkets, Kroger operates 771 convenience stores and 385 fine jewelry stores.

About Fry's
Fry’s is based in Tolleson, Arizona with 120 stores in AZ. Fry's was founded in 1954 by Donald Fry in California. 

Opportunity
We are always searching for individuals who share our passion for customer service, fairness, respect, openness, leadership and honesty. Whether you like working with people, numbers, ideas, food or pharmaceuticals, you can find a match with us. And with stores and offices in 32 states, we have opportunities for talented individuals nationwide, whether in a booming metropolis like Atlanta or in a small town like Martins Ferry, Ohio.

Diversity
The communities we serve are as diverse as America itself, and that diversity is reflected in our workforce. One of our greatest strengths is the diversity of talented employees we attract. In fact, the quality of our employees and the wide range of talents they bring to our company give us a strong competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Loyalty
At Kroger, loyalty is a two-way street – to both our customers and our employees. We offer competitive wages, health insurance, a solid 401(k) program, flexible hours and generous vacation time. And…more importantly, we promote from within whenever possible. Our roster includes leaders who began their careers bagging groceries.

Community
We seek out and welcome employees who are a part of, not apart from, their communities. Our employees are active participants in the community, working with schools, churches, and civic organizations. We treasure teamwork: between us and our employees; our employees and our customers; and between all of us and our communities.

title: Junior Developer
description:
In an ideal world, every user would be able to access their data platforms easily and regularly to find the information they need where and when they need it without any help. But often that data is in a variety of places and requires the intervention of
Amida's Development Team to string together a variety of functions, platforms, applications to make that happen. Our Developers use microservices to produce the desired result. In addition to design and implementation of our flexible and dynamic solutions, our engineers participate in every aspect of the software development lifecycle coding, test design, test implementation, optimization, and delivery utilizing the latest technologies.
Amida Technology Solutions is a Washington DC -based data management company that designs customized, open-source solutions for our clients. We were founded in 2013 by a small team of world-class experts in data interoperability and Health IT, and we have a proven track record of success with both government and private sector clients. We employ data scientists, analysts, architects, and engineers who are passionate about solving the hardest problems in data management to have a tangible impact on people's lives. 
What You Will Do
As one of our Junior Software Engineers, you will collaborate with clients, architects, and application architectures to understand the operational objectives and purpose of the future system integration. You will be responsible for designing and developing software using either Java or node.js and developing the front-end user interface with ReactJs.
Required Sills
You have demonstrated experience and references who are willing to speak to your skills and qualification. Specifically, you have:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS, MIS or a related technical field or equivalent work experienceExperience in:Agile developmentback-end development experience including Node.JS or javafront-end development experience including React JSusing Git/GitHub, preferably contributing to open-source projects
What Else You Should Know
Our people are known for their can-do attitude and their ability to work effectively with client teams. Communication is the key to success at Amida. We are looking for the following: 
Experience working with stakeholders to define the problem, explore options, and implement solutions.Exceptional communication, writing, coordination, and facilitation skills.Comfortable working independently, managing competing priorities, and proactively communicating with client stakeholders as needed.
At Amida, we help solve the biggest challenges in data management. If you're looking for an opportunity to help important organizations get their data right, we hope you'll forward your resume and let us know why this role appeals to you. We look forward to hearing from you.
Amida Technology Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We value diversity of ideas and people.
company_about: Amida Technology Solutions, Inc. (Amida) is a software services company that solves the most complex challenges in data interoperability, data exchange, data governance, and data security. We create and manage solutions that enable the reliable exchange of sensitive information — from conception through deployment. Amida securely develops and configures data resources for our clients, which include federal, state, and commercial enterprises. We build custom, open-source solutions that collect and prepare data from a variety of sources – independent of structure, format, provenance, and schema – for applications like business intelligence, predictive analytics (including AL, ML, and NLP), and downstream transactions. Additionally, we help select, configure, and run commercial-off-the-shelf applications for our clients. We are especially known for open data architectures and production services that are scalable, efficient, modular, and secure. Our software engineers and data scientists have extensive knowledge in data modeling, reconciliation, administration, and visualization – with vast experience in health IT.

title: Frontend Engineer - Remote
description:
We're looking for a Frontend Engineer to join a company in the Underdog.io network.
The Underdog.io network is a curated group of some of the fastest growing startups and tech companies in the country. We actively turn away more than 50% of companies that attempt to join.
We accept companies that offer competitive salaries, benefits, and perks. They're working on interesting technical challenges and must be respectful of your time to stay active.
Our companies look for Frontend Engineers proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and more. The ideal candidate is passionate about building UIs that solve complex problems and are delightful to use. Many of our companies are looking for mid-to-senior level talent, both individual contributors and managers.
To apply to the network, we'll ask you to fill out a 60-second web form. It's absolutely free.
If accepted, you'll hear directly from founders, hiring managers, and other key decision makers starting the following Monday. Our platform will hide your profile from your current employer.
Apply today!
Building an inclusive and diverse workplace is one of Underdog.io’s core values. We warmly welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.
JavaScript,Cascading Style Sheets (CSS),HTML,AngularJS,TypeScript,User Interface Design,Front-end Development,Web Development,HTML5,React.js
company_about:
Underdog.io builds software that helps job seekers find meaningful work at technology companies. Since launching in April 2014, we’ve connected thousands of candidates with hundreds of growing organizations in New York and San Francisco. We also help companies that are hiring remotely.

Candidates send Underdog.io their resumes and other basic information. Using a combination of human intelligence and technology, Underdog.io reviews and ranks candidates and sends a curated batch to our hiring network every week. Founders and hiring managers contact candidates directly and take them through their normal internal hiring process.

title: Associate Software Engineer - Backend
description:
About Us
At Globus, we move with a sense of urgency to deliver innovations that improve the quality of life of patients, inspired by the surgeons and healthcare providers who treat them. Our world-class engineering works to transform clinical insights into tangible musculoskeletal solutions. We are constantly in pursuit of better patient care, and we understand that speed is critical because life cannot wait. Join us!
Position Summary
The Associate Software Engineer will be a part of our rapidly growing Imaging, Navigation, and Robotics division. Here, we develop premium medical devices, including ExcelsiusGPS Surgical Robot and Excelsius3D Imaging System, by working with top surgeons and a cross-functional engineering team. The Associate Software Engineer will be responsible for general software development and support front-end code that drives features for platform software used in our products in hospitals. The position will be a hands-on one with an individual capable of creative and systematic product development.
Essential Functions
Developing prototypes in addition to production-quality solutions  Ensuring efficient performance and scalability of solutions  Demonstrating a passion for software development, software craftsmanship, and test-driven development  Contributing to design, testing and documentationMaintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies  Ability to work on sizeable individual efforts as well as on teams using agile methodologies  Adhering to the letter and spirit of the company Code of Conduct, the AdvaMed Code, MedTech Code, and all other company policies  Ensuring compliance with applicable governmental laws, rules, and regulations, both in the United States and internationally, by completing introductory and annual training and maintaining knowledge of compliance as it applies to your role  Representing the company in a professional manner and upholding the highest standards of ethical business practices and socially responsible conduct in all interactions with other employees, customers, suppliers, and other third parties of Globus 
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, a related technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience is required  Experience with Javascript, HTML, and CSS where you are comfortable writing and reading common front-end technologies and understand how they fit together  Experience in UI/UX development  Familiarity with REST APIs and working concurrently with both a backend team and a designer  Comfortable learning new technology languages such as Rust and C++  Comfortable learning new web technology stacks such as MERN and MEAN  Ability to work as a key contributor in small or large teams Excellent oral, written, and graphical communication skills
Our Values
Our Life Moves Us philosophy is built on four values: Passionate About Innovation, Customer Focused, Teamwork, and Driven.
Passionate about Innovation: Improving patient care by delivering advanced technology to our customers is at the core of what we do. We are passionate in our role in improving the lives of patients by continuously developing better solutions Customer Focused: We listen to our customers’ needs and respond with a sense of urgency Teamwork: Working together, anything is possible. We value every person on our team and treat each other with respect. We are accountable to one another and support each other. Together, we make each other stronger Driven: We pursue our mission with energy and passion. We are nimble, results-oriented and decisive. We overcome obstacles that arise in our quest to deliver solutions that will improve the lives of our customers and patients. 
Physical Demands
The physical demands listed here are representative of those that must be met by and employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl Required to regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds 
Required to possess specific visons abilities, including: close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and capacity to adjust focus.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Globus Medical is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, national origin or citizenship. We are committed to a diverse workforce. We value all employees’ talents and support an environment that is inclusive and respectful.
Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
JOB CODE: 1002722
company_about:
Globus Medical, Inc. is a leading musculoskeletal solutions company and is driving significant technological advancements across a complete suite of products. Founded in 2003, Globus’ single-minded focus on advancing surgery has made it the fastest growing company in the history of orthopedics. Globus is driven to utilize superior engineering and technology to achieve pain free, active lives for all patients.

Additional information can be accessed at www.globusmedical.com.

IMPORTANT NOTICE TO JOB APPLICANTS:

POTENTIAL FRAUD ALERT. Globus Medical has been made aware of an online scam where unknown entities are posing as Globus Medical recruiters in an attempt to obtain personal information as part of our application or job offer process.

Before providing any personal information to outside parties, please verify the following:

• All legitimate Globus Medical recruiter email addresses end with “@globusmedical.com”
• No application process should include a cloud-based document (ex. Google doc) asking for personal information
• The position described is found on our careers site at globusmedical.com/careers

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
About Numeric

We are a venture-backed startup building the next generation of accounting software, and we’ve started with a suite of products that helps accounting teams run an efficient, accurate, and collaborative financial close. With Numeric, teams have verifiable, detailed financial data to make better decisions, faster.

We are well funded and backed by great investors, including Founders Fund, Long Journey Ventures, and many founders and CFOs. We have amazing customers, such as Betterment, Heap, Masterworks, and Public.com (and many others which we cannot name yet).

We are excited to share more when we meet!

About The Role

We are looking to bring in key first engineers to meet ambitious goals for the product and lay the foundation for Numeric's engineering culture.

This is an opportunity to have a huge impact. You'll own large portions of the product and develop the core architecture of the platform. Furthermore, you'll drive toward the broader goals and make appropriate tradeoffs for an early, fast-moving startup. Finally, you'll grow with the role and be prepared to expand your impact as we scale.

How we work

🧩 We build robust, forward-looking architecture to support our platform for financial operations

🏰 We dog-food our work: the engineering team coordinates their work on Numeric

🚢 We ship early and often! We believe putting features out is the best way to learn & iterate, and deploys go out many times a day

🗣️ We understand our users. Everyone meets with customers and shares in the excitement & the challenges

🗝️ We empower. Everyone has the ownership and tools to do their best work and we rigorously protect the team's time so we can maximize our impact.

About You

We're looking for experienced engineers who have developed a variety of software. We are building a product that helps people to do their best work; the right candidate will be driven by seeing his/her impact, which means understanding the users and the business. To that end, you:
Take pride in building good softwareAre excited to hear pain points, desires, and feedback from customersConfidently own & build projects from beginning to endCan balance priorities; you'll recognize when to double-down on engineering investment, and when to ship something fastCan identify where existing 3rd party solutions will do, or even when no solution will doAre ambitious–constantly improving and learning

Skills
2+ years of experience building and delivering web applicationsExperienced across the stack—backend, frontend, tooling, deployments, etc. Should be comfortable operating as a generalist and solving problems where they arise. Able to identify the core logic/abstractions of the business, own implementing large categories of functionalityBackend focused; comfortable with SQL and data modeling/architecture

Our stack

Our main technologies are Typescript (React, Koa) and Postgres + SQL. Others we use (hosting, CI/CD, monitoring, admin, tooling) are subject to change!

How to reach us

If you are interested in joining our team, please send us an email at andrew@numeric.io.

title: Front End Developer (Remote)
description:
Remote opportunity in the US or Canada
Since launching TeamUp, a DaySmart company, in 2012, we have consistently had one mission: to provide the best management software for fitness studios, boxes, and gyms. We provide boutique gyms, studios, boxes, and independent fitness businesses with professional management software. We work with thousands of like-minded owners who help millions of customers achieve their goals.
Website (http://goteamup.com/)
TeamUp is the most recommended management software for in-person and online classes at fitness studios, boxes, and gyms, worldwide.
When using TeamUp, managing day-to-day processes (customer billing, instructor payroll, receipts, business analytics) will be seamless, hassle-free, save time, and allow our customers to focus on elevating their business's success. Our software will help empower our customers to build the business they dreamed about when they started them.
From the customer's perspective, booking a class or workout has never been easier than it is when the gym is TeamUp. Our software enables consumers to enjoy their classes and the smooth booking experience without the hassle they've been used to with other systems.
As a Frontend Engineer at TeamUp, you will ship delightful experiences to every customer and potential customer who visits TeamUp’s site. Our Product Team is small, so you'll have a big impact and opportunities to work and learn across a wide range of projects. You will help with technical decisions, collaborate with other engineers on the team, partner with stakeholders cross-functionally, and be part of the team that defines our product strategy. On a typical day, you can expect to write code, plan future work by writing tech specs or reviewing design docs, lead projects, contribute to documentation, write automated tests, collaborate across disciplines, and mentor other engineers. And if you do well and help us grow, you may be given the opportunity to manage a team if you're interested in that.
The salary range for this role is $80,000 to $110, 000 USD per year. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, internal equity, etc.
What you'll do
+
Develop elegant and responsive user interfaces using the latest frontend technologies
+
Build, maintain, and improve core customer-facing features
+
Collaborate with our product, design, and backend development teams
+
Develop tools that improve frontend development productivity and minimize developer friction
Must have
+
Must have solid experience with Vue and modern frontend technologies, concerns, and patterns
+
3+ years of professional experience
+
Experience working with implementing designs from Figma, Sketch, Zeplin, etc
+
You'll need to be able to work remotely from the US or Canada. Work authorization required, we do not support visa transfers
+
Ability to work independently and take ownership and initiative to achieve desired results
+
Willingness to roll up your sleeves, find answers, and help your teammates
Nice to have
+
Experience working in a fast-paced, Agile organization
+
BS or MS in computer science, engineering, or other technical degrees
DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.
Powered by JazzHR

Everyone on our team knows that without your business, we don’t have a business.

description:
Overview
Data Management Services, Inc. (DMS), a BRMi Company, is a progressive information and management sciences company dedicated to serving our clients in the biomedical research, public health, and small business sectors. For almost four decades, we’ve worked to create an environment where highly qualified individuals can collaborate to create the highest quality solutions for our customers. At DMS we don’t view our clients as “vertical market sectors” but rather as individuals with unique requirements, priorities and goals. We leverage frequent, honest communications processes to collaborate with our clients to find solutions tailored to their needs.
As a Junior Developer, you will participate in the successful support and feature enhancement development of an application that is integral to the successful daily request fulfillment process for various government contracts. You will collaborate with other individuals as part of a cross-functional team that will see this project through all phases of the development process from inception to daily usage ‘in the wild’.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and commitment at all levels. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. Employment policies and decisions on employment and promotion are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. The decisions and criteria governing the employment relationship with all employees are made in a nondiscriminatory manner, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, or any other factor determined to be unlawful by federal, state, or local statutes.
company_about:
BRMi is an information technology services provider. Whether it’s a digital transformation, migration to the cloud, intelligent automation, visual analytics, or otherwise thriving in today’s e-world, BRMi has been Executing Change and Accelerating Outcomes for its clients since 2004, using critical business performance and process information to create and deliver timely, targeted, high-value solutions.

While we’re known for our work with the federal government, we serve both public and private sectors—from the national security establishment to monetary and financial institutions, statistical and regulatory bodies, and many others. We have real-world experience and cross-domain expertise.

BRMi aligns to its clients’ needs. We don’t push predetermined solutions; rather, we listen to the root issues and consider situations and goals. We affect simplicity through process automation, effective change management, actionable architecture, and holistic solutions.

The industry and client service awards BRMi has received are reflective of and contribute to its reputation as a trusted source for talent and creativity and as a reliable, high-value service provider in current and emerging information technologies.

title: Solution Engineer Intern
description:
Who We Are:
Anvl is on a mission to deliver a connected experience for the deskless workforce. Our solutions are used on a daily basis by Fortune 500 and Global 2000 companies globally to make a difference every day in safety, quality, and productivity.
Our partners and customers work with Anvl to intervene on behalf of front-line workers using leading edge mobile technology, data science, language processing, and dynamic workflows.
We need innovative thinkers to design, build, and deliver a high quality and robust Enterprise workforce solution.
By leveraging the latest in emerging technologies, we bring practical solutions to businesses of all sizes. Our team members work in a collaborative environment, and we are committed to providing an employee experience with opportunities every day to identify new challenges, innovate, design, build, deliver and grow.
We are building a high-caliber, fast-paced team to deliver on our mission. You can make a difference in the lives of others every day - come join us!
What We Value:
The Anvl culture is centered around Pioneer Spirit and is composed of five key elements:
Integrity | Growth | Transparent Collaboration | Outperform | Persistence
What We are Looking For:
We’re looking for someone who wants to help with publishing workflows for customers and managing the overall process. You enjoy being proactive rather than reactive.
Experience working and collaborating within others, both technical and non-technical personnelComfort communicating to business stakeholders and constructing documentationA desire for professional development and continued learningExcitement for the rapid pace of a growing, changing startup environment
What You Will Do:
A Solution Engineer Intern at Anvl will focus on publishing workflows for our customers. You will work directly with customers as well as our Engineering and Customer Success teams to ensure workflows are operating correctly across various languages (we don’t expect you to know any languages beyond English). You’ll use a diagram tool and a language tool to translate those workflows into other languages. You’ll also utilize scripts for publishing workflows to a mobile app. This will involve testing, fixing issues, overseeing timelines and deliverables, and coordinating with Engineering to improve processes.
Requirements
Experience with diagram tools (e.g. Visio, draw.io)Experience running command-line toolsIdeally experience in AWSIdeally experience maintaining Bash scriptsIdeally experience with Node.jsObsessive attention to detail and a relentless pursuit of excellenceA growth mindset and willingness to go the extra mile for the team’s successHistory of building and maintaining strong relationships with customers and coworkersEntrepreneurial mindset and desire to be a key part of a startup environment An ability to move quickly and adapt to our rapidly changing and growing market and customer needs
Benefits
Flexible, remote working environmentPowderkeg award winning culture
At Anvl, we’re building a team of pioneers who are driven to do the hard work that matters most. If you’re curious, ambitious, and ready to grow your career, we’d love to hear from you!
company_about: Anvl helps unlock critical data in real-time by connecting frontline workers and supervisors, through a single platform. Anvl delivers real-time data to streamline processes, improve quality, and keep your frontline safe. Our in-app messaging provides in-the-moment guidance, alerts, and analytics, resulting in improved productivity, reduced costs, and time savings.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Who We Are
Aegis Ventures is a next-generation venture capital studio that pairs entrepreneurs and industry leaders to launch and scale transformative companies. We bring together market-shaping ideas, permanent growth resources, and talented individuals, to build in three key areas of artificial intelligence, health technology, and wellness. www.aegisventures.com
About Us
Ascertain is a venture studio committed to creating the next generation of healthcare technology companies that advance outcomes at scale. Ascertain was built on the promise that cutting-edge developments in artificial intelligence, when paired with a deep understanding of healthcare, can fundamentally transform medicine.
By placing patient needs at the center of every business model, solution and product we develop, our companies enhance patient experience, improve quality of care, and address health inequities - creating a virtuous cycle of positive healthcare and commercial impact. Ascertain is closely integrated with our founding investors, including one of the largest health systems in the US, Northwell Health, to create a robust company creation platform that facilitates ideation, model creation, and product development.
About The Role
Ascertain is seeking a Frontend Engineer to support us in building world-changing products with a one-of-a-kind collection of clinical, non-clinical, and operational data to transform care and improve outcomes through cutting-edge AI/ML-enabled applications. The Frontend Engineer will work closely with our AI and engineering teams to execute against the product roadmap for healthcare products. The role will be remote with quarterly touchpoints in New York at the Ascertain headquarters and onsite with our partners at Northwell.
What You'll Do
Support the initial launch of the Ascertain platform by building applications and services that enable positive user experiences. Participate in all aspects of agile software development including design, implementation, and deployment. Work closely with our product team to provide requirements feedback early in the product life cycle. Leverage continuous deployment best practices to create fast feedback loops with our users. Improve our codebase through continual testing and refactoring. 
What You'll Gain
A highly competitive compensation package, including top-tier benefits and equity in the startups that you help launch and scale. An unparalleled, hands-on experience in deep tech startup operations, highlighted by the chance to bring new ventures to life across the broad spectrum of healthcare technology. An opportunity to help lead a rapidly growing, mission-driven company with the potential to save lives and transform how clinical care is delivered. A chance to work with a highly talented, close-knit team who can act as a support network and sounding board throughout your entrepreneurial journey. Top-tier health, vision, wellness, commuter, and dental benefits. Exciting opportunities for career development as our team scales. 
What You Have
At least five years of software engineering experience. Advanced experience working with JavaScript and Typescript. Experience working with JavaScript libraries such as React. Experience developing against RESTful APIs. Experience working with cloud technologies. Experience working in an agile environment (standups, sprint planning, retrospectives, etc.). Experience working with product managers and product designers. Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively within a team environment. Experience at a fast-paced, high-growth company is a plus. Experience working in regulated industries such as healthcare is a plus. 
Additional Details
For this role, the base salary range is $170,000 - $200,000 with an eligible cash bonus. A salary offer will be determined by several factors including experience, skill level, education, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. Total compensation also includes a stock option grant and a competitive benefits package. This role is fully remote and open to candidates in the US. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. 
Ascertain is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer — we recruit, train, compensate and promote our team members based on qualifications. We encourage you to apply regardless of your race, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Aegis Ventures is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer — we recruit, train, compensate and promote our team members based on qualifications. We encourage you to apply regardless of your race, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.
company_about:
Aegis Ventures is a next-generation startup studio that partners with entrepreneurs and industry leaders to originate, launch, and scale transformative companies. The Aegis platform brings together market-shaping ideas, permanent growth capital, and ambitious individuals who are driven to solve major societal problems.

We aim to build companies with the capacity for vast impact, with an initial focus on artificial intelligence and health technologies. Within healthcare, Aegis seeks to create companies that use technology to transform healthcare quality, access, and cost, focusing on innovations that promote seamless continuity of care, patient empowerment, and better-informed clinical decision-making.

title: Frontend Engineer II
description:
Position: Full time, flexible hours, Local Portland Oregon applicants only. 
Rapta is driving a revolution in American manufacturing by facilitating the return of production jobs to the U.S. Our powerful AI software platform automates the deployment of vision-based AI systems for manufacturing, inspection, and process control. 
Working closely with some of the industry's most prominent customers, we deliver top-notch AI vision systems via the most sophisticated ML ops automation platform available today. 
We're seeking a mid-level Frontend Engineer II to bolster our expanding team, directly reporting to our CTO. 
In this role, you will be responsible for enhancing and maintaining our app-like web-based user interface. Your duties will encompass gathering and translating requirements into tangible features and improvements. 
The ideal candidate should possess the following:
A strong team spirit, willing to contribute across a spectrum of tasks, including testing, system validation, and development. Excellent collaboration skills to engage effectively with diverse teams. Outstanding communication skills, augmented by a curious and enthusiastic mindset. Demonstrated proficiency in Python, Dash, React, CSS, and Javascript or Typescript. Demonstrated experience in transforming requirements into well-defined tasks and units of work. Experience with version control systems (such as Git) and collaboration tools like JIRA. A humble, team-oriented attitude, acknowledging that collective efforts fuel success. 

Benefits: We offer 100% coverage of medical, dental and vision insurance for employees and their immediate families of up to 4 people. 
Rapta is a proud Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Our commitment to diversity and inclusivity resonates across our workforce. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. 
Please note: We only accept direct applications from candidates. Submissions from recruiters or agencies will not be entertained. 
Join us in our exciting journey to reshape American manufacturing with groundbreaking AI technology!
company_about:
Rapta is an applied AI software company that helps companies improve profitability, quality of manufactured product and accelerate training of manufacturing staff.

Our AI Supercoach provides inline QA for manufacturing line workers & robotic processes and catches quality issues as they happen. Human operators are trained in real time by our AI software and video-based work instructions, up-skilling them on your assembly processes while ensuring quality of the work being completed. 

Our tools provide supervisors with task level analytics to help determine bottlenecks, eliminate human errors and ultimately, improve and optimize production workflows.

The AI Supercoach can be deployed in less than a day and ensures high quality of every part manufactured protecting your brand and ISO/Quality certification.  

Learn more: https://rapta.ai

Human operators are trained in real time by our AI software and video-based work instructions, up-skilling them on your assembly processes while ensuring quality of the work being completed. 

Our tools provide supervisors with task level analytics to help determine bottlenecks, eliminate human errors and ultimately, improve and optimize production workflows.

The AI Supercoach can be deployed in less than a day and ensures high quality of every part manufactured protecting your brand and ISO/Quality certification.  

Learn more: https://rapta.ai

title: Frontend Developer - May 2023
description:
For one of our clients we are looking for a Frontend Developer
Project Description
Crystal is an analytics software product for clinical trial operation that visualizes complex operational clinical trial data. It provides transparency and monitoring into BI clinical trial performance.Crystal is developed using an Agile methodology, a blend of scrum and Kanban.
Background To The Assignment
The product aims to visualize complex data stories in compelling ways, utilizing data visualization and data storytelling best practices in graphs, charts, infographics, dashboards, and geographic visualization techniques.A core aspect of this methodology is that all people who are involved in a product development endeavor are self-sufficient and do not follow any instructions. The steps and ways of how overarching goals are achieved can be defined by the contractor independently and individually. This special combination of know-how is not available at Boehringer Ingelheim. Due to this special combination of know-how, the external Contractor will have an outstanding position compared to the internal project staff and will perform significantly different services than the internal staff.
Tasks
Creating JavaScript based user interfaces based on designs provided by UX research through the usage of at least one front-end framework like Angular or React and D3.jsUtilizing git for version control and performing code reviews along with paired programming in order to create a robust code with low tech debt.Maintaining docker images to facilitate the CI/CD enabled git repository and troubleshoot a Jenkins workflow with a Jenkins file.Creating automated testing to include unit as well as functional testing.Perform code review on pull requests and participate in paired programming activities.Plan, execute, and review the sprint goals and tasks with the team according to the sprint cycles.
Further Info
We are looking for people who are innovative and are able to leverage the newest technologies like co-pilot to develop quickly and with high quality.It would be very beneficial to have a portfolio of your work so we can understand what you have done. In the interview, your job is to impress us with your qualifications.Any applicant requires previous experience working successfully embedded in an agile team, understanding of agile development principles and a proven ability to proactively support agile team processes. 100% Team players only.At least 5 years of previous experience working in this field is required.MUST HAVE Command of EnglishGerman is a Plus
Start: ASAP
Duration: 2 months+
Location: 90% Remote/ 10% onsite in Ingelheim (once a month)
