title: Full stack Software Engineer
description:
At Advisor360°, we hire people with all kinds of awesome experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives. We like it that way. So even if you don't meet every single requirement, please consider applying if you like what you see. Though many of our roles are assigned to a particular office location, most are a hybrid of remote and in-person work.
We hire people with all kinds of awesome experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives. We like it that way. So even if you don't meet every single requirement, please consider applying if you like what you see.
Key Responsibilities
 Contribute to our software engineering initiatives to deliver well-defined products that generate immense customer value and personally deliver high-quality, broadly applicable software contributions  Continue to gain and maintain knowledge of software design patterns and code concepts by understanding business needs   Provide ongoing maintenance and technical support to the team with enhancements in existing systems and platforms while documenting for continuity  Collaborate with others across the organization to understand our business needs, to improve and optimize our product, infrastructure, and software functionality     Perform regular code resolution and gap analysis by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing development and service issues to accelerate project progress inclusive of routine bugs  Follow the coding standards and development procedures Design and develop services with a strong focus on high availability, quality, and testability, using the tools effectively to document design and track execution The ability to lead a small project independently inside of the team 
Preferred Strengths
 Exposure to test automation tools /frameworks (Selenium), executed through CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins) a plus  
Requirements, Skills, And Knowledge
 BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Web Design and/or equivalent industry experience 3+ years of programming experienceKnowledge of .Net and Python4+ years of software engineering experience building and releasing web applications  4+of Angular 5/npm/Swagger/TypeScript, or related technologies, along with client-side frameworks and languages, such as jQueryKnowledge of software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, specifically with Agile/SCRUM methodology Familiarity with Jira, Confluence, and other related technologies High threshold to work within highly complex and ambiguous situations Knowledge of best practices within the software development life cycle Ability to work and communicate effectively across disciplines and teams Strong design, implementation, and testing skills  
About Advisor360°
Come grow with us! Join a team of inventive, driven professionals!
Launched in 2019, Advisor360° combines a start-up's agile and innovative markers with the stability of an established enterprise. Ranked the largest FinTech company in Massachusetts by the Boston Business Journal, Advisor360° was born out of 20 years of feedback from the industry's highest-producing financial advisors and has gone on to build a software that is second to none.
Our company specializes in building, delivering, and integrating technology for wealth managers. Our comprehensive platform offers a unified approach to managing wealth, delivering a connected experience to advisors and their clients.
Benefits include a competitive bonus plan, unlimited paid time off, paid sick time, volunteer time off, free access to vacation homes, a generous 401(k) employer match, stock appreciation rights, referral bonuses, 80% of either HMO or PPO premiums for individuals and family employer covered, 50% of dental insurance paid for, employer life and AD&D at 2X salary, short- and long-term disability coverage, a health savings account, flexible spending accounts, and paid bonding time for new parents.
Advisor360° also provides worthwhile perks, including a hybrid structure with most employees working from the office 2 to 3 times per week, tuition reimbursement, professional development opportunities, employee assistance programs, and more!
Join us on this journey. Advisor360° is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We believe diversity drives innovation and are therefore building a company where people of all backgrounds are truly welcome and included. Everyone is encouraged to bring their unique, authentic selves to work each and every day. The way we see it, we are here to learn from each other.
Are you ready to build and discover together?

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Are you interested in working in a dynamic environment that offers opportunities for professional growth and new responsibilities by helping clients drive alignment with their business, advising through critical and complex issues, while allowing you to develop personally and professionally? Then consider a career at NS2 Mission. We have grown into an industry leading provider of technology services to the IC, DoD, and U.S. Government.
Position Overview
NS2 Mission is seeking a Full-Stack Developer (front end & back end technical skills) to directly support application enhancement and functionality. The successful candidate will be responsible for software development, creation of scripts, and creating and maintaining automated deployment and testing software. The developer will provide support for the application, address user reported bugs, and respond to application inquiries. The developer must possess excellent communication skills and be adept at communicating effectively with key stakeholders, mission partners and power users to understand and respond requirements and needs. The developer must be able to work well independently and within the team.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience12+ years of experience with full stack development using any of the common object oriented or functional languages (Java, Python, Scala, C++, JavaScript)Demonstrated experience with UI frameworks such as Angular, React, Node.js, ElmDemonstrated hand-on experience with distributed cross-platform applications, orchestration, and securityDemonstrated experience of a basic understanding of cloud architecture of at least one major cloud service provider and familiarity with deploying applications in a cloud environmentDemonstrated experience of software quality process/assurance including automation testing, unit/integration testing, design/code review, code profiling and software continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelinesDemonstrated experience with relational, noSQL, and/or graph databases (e.g., Neo4j, MongoDB, MySQL, Oracle, etc.)
Desired Qualifications
Demonstrated experience in continuous integration and delivery tools (e.g., Git, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, etc.)Demonstrated experience in Web server technologies (Tomcat, Web Logic, IIS, HttpCore)Familiarity with LDAP/Active DirectoryFamiliarity with in-memory databases Experience working in an Agile scrum teamwork environment
Position Clearance Requirement
Will support TS/SCI - FSP
 Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain or maintain a U.S security clearance which requires U.S citizenship. 
NS2 Mission is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. NS2 Mission is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, characteristic or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local laws.
By submitting your resume for this position, you understand and agree that NS2 Mission may share your resume, as well as any other related personal information or documentation you provide in your application, with its affiliated companies for the purpose of considering you for other available positions.
 NS2 Mission maintains a drug-free workplace and may perform pre-employment substance abuse testing, where required by contract and permitted by law.
company_about:
NS2 Mission’s expert engineers and intelligence analysts provide tailored solutions to our nation’s classified Department of Defense and Intelligence Community, employing emerging technologies and pushing the technical edge. Our subject matter experts have longstanding relationships with operational customers, supporting and developing mission-critical applications, on-site and on a global scale. 
NS2 Mission understands the pain points and constraints, and we craft software and technological solutions that break through complex problems. We use agile DevOps techniques to integrate National and Tactical capabilities and employ a Next-Gen Analytics Framework on multiple intelligence domains to power intelligence at the edge. NS2 Mission specializes in secure cloud-based solutions, leveraging open standards to deliver solutions from data management and analytics to sensor systems and spatial visualization. In speeding data exposure and analysis, we empower decision makers’ overall awareness, support rapid delivery of critical information, and decrease reaction time. Our end-goal is to provide a full-spectrum approach to solving the nation’s most critical and unique mission requirements.
Follow us on Twitter for the latest news! https://twitter.com/NS2Mission

We are looking for a UI/UX Designer to join our team to help us create innovative and user-friendly product experiences. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of user-centered design principles and be able to translate user needs into elegant and effective solutions. They will also be able to work closely with development teams to ensure that their designs are implemented correctly. Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, visual communications design, or relevant field.3+years’ experience in UX design or related field.3+ years’ experience with design tools such as Figma, Sketch, In Vision, or similar.Knowledge of front-end development technologies.Must be able to provide a Portfolio highlighting multiple UX projects.Preferred Skills: Strong understanding of user-centered design principles.Strong passion for advocacy and educating team members on the value of design.Ability to illustrate design ideas using wireframes, storyboards, process flows, clickable prototypes, and high-fidelity designs.Ability to conduct user research and usability testing. Remote position available immediately. H1B sponsorship is not available for this position. This Company offers very competitive benefits including employee paid insurance, PTO, 401k match, profit sharing and much more.  INDITISDKM

We offer government transformative business solutions by leveraging the right combination of people, processes, and technology. title: Interface Engineer
description:
At the Great Falls Clinic Hospital, we pride ourselves on providing high quality care and exceptional service to our patients. Here you will find excellent nurse to patient ratios. This allows us to provide more personalized care and create stronger connections. You will discover a culture of teamwork, compassion, and an opportunity for professional growth.
Position Overview
The HL7 Interface Engineer maintains existing and brings new source systems into the Great Falls Clinic/Hospital System Umbrella. Our technology platform supports more than 20 applications including a Community Health Record Solution that is designed to meet the diverse needs of the many different users of a state's Health Information Exchange (HIE). This role focuses on acquiring data from various sources that we leverage inside our Health System. This role must become accustomed to both the technical and business details of the source systems and engage with multiple technologies to acquire, transform, deploy, and validate new sources of data. That data will be provided in formats like HL7 2.x, C-CDA, and others. This role will assist staff in understanding pre-requisites, troubleshooting issues, and sharing knowledge.
Education
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or similar concentration, required.Equivalent experience and/or certifications may be considered in lieu of a degree.Master's Degree in Business or IT, preferred.
Experience
 5+ years' experience in healthcare technology-related field with a concentration in interface support and management, highly preferred.
License/Certifications
HL7 Certification, required.API Certification, preferred.
Knowledge/Skills/AbilitiesAbility to read specifications for industry standards like FHIR (r4), HL7 2.x, C-CDA, IHE ITI TF-2, or EDI X12 (Claims), required.Ability to read in at least one coding language (C# recommended), required.*This role will not be performing software development.*
Notice Of Pre-employment Screening Requirements
If you receive a job offer, please note all offers are contingent upon passing a pre-employment screening, which includes:
Criminal background checkDrug ScreeningHealth and Immunizations Screening
About Us
In 1917, four visionary medical leaders opened a world-class comprehensive health care center, with an integrated team of specialists and a personal approach to wellness - far from an urban center. Today, we are focused on becoming Montana's healthcare provider of choice.
We are committed to recruiting the most contemporary medical staff, harnessing the power of the latest medical technologies, continually striving for advancement, and above all, working as a team to meet the health needs of the 250,000 residents living in our 17 local counties.
Our vision is to be the healthcare provider of choice for patients and the workplace of choice for staff and providers. We will achieve this vision by committing to a culture of integrity and safety, evidence based exceptional care, compassionate customer service, great work environment and innovation/technology.
About Great Falls
Great Falls lies about halfway between Yellowstone and Glacier National Parks. With close access to world class fishing and floating, not only on the Missouri River, but also several other lakes and rivers. Great Falls is an active community within 1 hour of two local ski resorts. We encourage a fun, collaborative work environment as well as a good work/home life balance. If you are interested in being a part of a dynamic, impactful team, in a family friendly community, Great Falls and Great Falls Clinic Hospital are for you. We would love to hear from you and discuss this opportunity.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Great Falls Clinic, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA/M-F/Vet/Disability). We encourage all qualified individuals to apply for employment. We do not discriminate against any applicant or employee based on protected veteran status, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
PI227681214
company_about:
The Great Falls Clinic is a multi-specialty group medical practice emphasizing primary practice care, medical specialties and urgent care. Founded in 1917, the Great Falls Clinic is the fourth oldest medical clinic west of the Mississippi. Originally based on the vision that quality healthcare need not be confined to large urban centers, our mission today is focused on providing leadership in medicine through teamwork. To accomplish our goal, we strive to assess and meet the needs of the 225,000 residents living in the seventeen north central Montana counties that we serve.

As a leader in the Great Falls medical delivery system, the Great Falls Clinic works hard as a team of providers to institute positive change for our patients throughout Montana. The combination of physicians and employees working together to improve patient care is our commitment and can be defined as “Team Care.” Our Team has a responsibility to constantly strive to perform better services and to create more value for the people we serve.

The Great Falls Clinic is proud to be a physician-led and governed organization and we understand that with leadership comes responsibility. One thing that will not change moving forward is that we will continue to have physicians and employees working together to bring the population of Montana the best healthcare possible.

title: Full Stack Software Developer
description:
Company Overview:
At CaryRx, we are not just a pharmacy; we are a pioneering tech company committed to transforming the healthcare landscape. As a fast-growing startup, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the way people experience healthcare services. Our mission is to make healthcare more accessible, convenient, and efficient for all individuals.
Position Overview:
We are seeking a talented and passionate Full Stack Developer to join our growing team based in Washington, D.C. As a Full Stack Developer, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining our web applications and digital solutions. Your role will encompass both front-end and back-end development, working on cutting-edge technologies to deliver exceptional user experiences. If you are a self-motivated individual with a keen eye for detail and a strong desire to create innovative solutions, we invite you to be part of our dynamic team.
Key Responsibilities Full Stack Development:Collaborate with the development team to design and implement user-centric web applications and features from concept to deploymentDevelop and maintain both front-end and back-end components of our digital solutions, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performanceFront-End Development:Create responsive and visually appealing user interfaces using modern front-end technologies, such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React or AngularEnsure cross-browser compatibility and optimize applications for various devices and screen sizesBack-End Development:Design and develop server-side logic and APIs using programming languages like Python, Node.js, or JavaImplement and maintain databases, ensuring data security and efficient queryingSystem Architecture and Scalability:Work closely with the team to architect and optimize systems for scalability, performance, and reliabilityIdentify potential bottlenecks and propose solutions to enhance application efficiencyCode Review and Quality Assurance:Conduct code reviews to maintain code quality, consistency, and best practicesPerform testing and debugging to identify and resolve issues in a timely mannerCollaboration and Communication:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and other developers, to deliver high-quality solutionsCommunicate technical concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical team membersResearch and Innovation:Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practicesProactively propose innovative ideas to improve existing applications and workflows
Requirements
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related fieldProven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role, with at least 3-5 years of relevant work experienceStrong proficiency in front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern front-end frameworks (React, Angular, etc.)Solid understanding of back-end development using languages such as Python, Node.js, or Java, and proficiency in working with databases (SQL, NoSQL)Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflowsExperience with cloud computing platforms and deployment tools (e.g., AWS, Azure, Heroku) is a plusKnowledge of web security principles and best practicesExcellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex technical issuesStrong communication and teamwork abilities, with a passion for learning and sharing knowledgeExcellent organizational skills and attention to detailAbility to work independently as well as collaboratively with cross-functional teamsFlexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work schedules as neededDemonstrated can-do attitude and a commitment to delivering high-quality serviceCandidates must be authorized to work in the United States to be eligible to apply for this position
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with modern front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js, and the ability to architect and develop complex, interactive user interfacesProficiency in back-end development using languages like Python, Node.js, or Java, and familiarity with frameworks like Django, Express.js, or SpringStrong understanding of database management and design, including experience with SQL and NoSQL databases like MongoDB, MySQL, or PostgreSQLFamiliarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and knowledge of deploying and scaling applications in cloud environmentsPrevious involvement in building and integrating RESTful APIs and microservices, ensuring efficient communication between different components of a web applicationExperience with containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes, enabling seamless deployment and management of applicationsKnowledge of DevOps practices, including continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD), and the ability to implement automated testing and deployment pipelinesUnderstanding of web security principles and best practices, ensuring the development of secure and robust web applicationsProven track record of collaborating with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and other developers, to deliver high-quality solutionsExperience with Agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, and the ability to work in an iterative and collaborative development environmentParticipation in open-source projects or contributions to the developer community, showcasing a passion for learning and sharing knowledge
Benefits
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)Short Term & Long Term DisabilityLife Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)Salary Range: Commensurate with qualifications and experience
Join us in Washington, D.C., to be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. As a Full Stack Developer, you will have the opportunity to contribute to impactful projects that drive positive change and make a difference in people's lives. If you are a highly motivated and skilled developer who thrives in a dynamic environment, we look forward to receiving your application.
CaryRx is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
company_about: CaryRx is a digital pharmacy that facilities a mobile pharmacy experience for patients, population management platform for health plans and fulfillment solution for manufacturers. The CaryRx platform improves outcomes, increases access and eliminates friction in the pharmacy experience.

Role: WordPress Web Designer
Start Date: 09/05/2023
Last Date: 06/28/2024
Location: Richmond, VA 23219
Description:
WordPress Web Designer
This position supports the Web Team which is responsible for the appearance, maintenance, functionality and security of the agency’s websites. This role requires proficiency in graphic design software (i.e. Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop) in order to design website layouts, prepare images/documents for posting, as well as proficiency in HTML/CSS/JavaScript. Proficiency in WordPress is required. This position will deal directly with internal clients. Good communication skills and the ability to complete assignments in a timely manner are a must.
Typical Core Duties:
Website Development and Maintenance
 Support and maintain agency’s internal and external websites and web applications. Design and develop websites within CLIENT Web Team guidelines. Apply graphic design skills to create attractive visuals. Utilize agency-specified applications to create web ready graphics. Design web forms. Design websites to improve functionality; confirm integration with other systems; install and test content. Update and maintain time-sensitive material. Obtain copyright clearances where required. Deliver web pages to client/user as requested; disposes of outdated information/files; discusses obvious content errors with clients and corrects as necessary; recommends changes in editorial policy and site design. Revise content to ensure its quality, including accuracy, authority, clarity, accessibility and usability. Perform analysis, design, development and testing of usable, accessible web applications. Identify multimedia content needed to support or work alongside textual content. Coordinates with multimedia specialists as necessary. Ensure quality, compliance, usability, accessibility, copyright and other legal compliance. Compiles and analyzes website usage statistics.
Customer Service
 Provide technical assistance by responding to inquiries regarding errors, problems, or questions regarding collaboration platform systems. Provides technical leadership and training to customers and partners. Develop strong client relationships and demonstrate a high level of commitment to client success.
Position works with a high degree of independence. Seeks guidance from supervisor for politically sensitive, legal or controversial matters as well as technical/design issues.
N/A
 Graduate from an accredited College or University with a degree in Communication Arts or related field preferred and/or equivalent WordPress/Website Design training and experience. Detail-oriented with extensive knowledge of WordPress, Photoshop, CSS. Experience creating forums, lists, document libraries, and forms. Demonstrated ability to convert business requirements into an accessible website layout. Experience with web site design and development. Experience with project management. Ability to provide excellent customer service to internal and external customers regarding guidance and troubleshooting; provide assistance and guidance on development projects; understand policies; and use professional judgment and discretion. Ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing to diverse audiences, foster relationships at all levels; team members, partners, management, vendors, and both internal and external customers. Demonstrate excellent organization and interpersonal skills; problem resolution and decision making. Bachelor''s degree in Communication Arts or related field preferred and/or equivalent WordPress/Website Design training and experience. Experience managing an existing WordPress implementation.
Required / Desired Skills
 Detail-oriented with extensive knowledge of WordPress, Photoshop, CSS. Required 2 Years Experience with web site design and development. Required 2 Years Ability to provide excellent customer service to internal and external customers Required 1 Years Working knowledge of Section 508 accessibility guidelines & best practices Required 2 Years

Founded in 1993, Rose International is a leader in providing Staffing and Total Talent Solutions nationwide. We have offices across the U.S. and offer thousands of opportunities across the industries we service. 

Rose International is an employee-oriented company. We offer challenging assignments and strive to be with our employees long-term. We are committed to quality people and service. At Rose, we offer our employees the opportunity to join a highly skilled, professional team and provide continuous professional development.
 
Employees of Rose International get the opportunity to work for some of the best corporations and government agencies across the country. title: Dirt Operator
description:
Your Job
The jobsite located in Midland, TX has an opening for a Dirt Operator.
Our Team
Optimized Process Designs, LLC (OPD) is an engineering/construction company headquartered in Katy, TX with an expertise in the natural gas, natural gas liquids, and petrochemical industries. OPD is part of the larger Koch Engineered Solutions (KES) organization which provides a variety of capabilities across many industries. Originally incorporated in 1980, OPD has developed a strong reputation for honesty, integrity, and ability to successfully execute projects. OPD has a key advantage in being able to supply construction services as well as engineering/procurement. This enables clients to have a ''one stop shop'' for the overall project, providing increased efficiency and avoiding potential interface problems. OPD's industry experience, flexibility, and personal attention have made us a preferred partner to our customers and our tight knit, highly productive, team atmosphere makes OPD a great place to work.
What You Will Do
Some core responsibilities for a Equipment Operator include:
Adhere to all plant safety and environmental guidelines, policies, and procedures Efficiently and safely operate heavy mobile equipment of various sizes and weights associated with open pit mining Perform minor service and maintenance on equipment Recognize and document potential job hazards in compliance with company policies Work as a team to help meet or exceed production, waste and quality goals Perform general housekeeping duties to continuously maintain a safe and clean work environment Work in a hot, humid, cold, and noisy industrial environment Work any shift, holidays, weekends and overtime as needed Perform tasks such as lifting, walking, climbing, stooping, standing, pushing, and/or pulling for at least eight (8) hours Maintain strict adherence to safety rules and regulations, to include safety equipment 
We expect all field employees to: 
Actively participate in a strong safety culture. Recognize safety hazards and risks. Participate in onsite safety meetings. Follow OPD and client safety policies and procedures. Be aware of changing conditions on an active jobsite. Be on time to the jobsite each day ready for work. Display a positive attitude and be able to work in a team environment. 
Some physical demands of being a Equipment Operator include:
Capable of working in outdoor weather and environmental conditions including extreme heat and humidity, extreme cold, and high elevations. Lifting and carrying awkward objects up to 60 lbs. Standing for extended periods of time up to 11 hours per day. Breaks are given in 2.5 hour intervals. Moving the entire body. Considerable use of arms, legs, climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, crawling, twisting, reaching, and bending on a regular basis. Must have good hand-eye coordination. Use hands to handle, control, and feel objects and/or tools.
Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)
Six (6) months or more of experience operating one or more of the following in the construction and/or mining field: -End dump truck - Caterpillar 770 class or larger, -Excavator- Caterpillar 325 class or larger, -Front-end loader Caterpillar 950 class or larger -Dozer- Caterpillar D8 class or large -Wirtgen Surface Miner 2200SM Ability to work in an industrial environment as described in the position Ability to meet the physical requirements of the position Ability to adhere to the safety regulations of the position
What Will Put You Ahead
One (1) year or more of experience working with construction and/or mining equipment experience Currently parts 48 MSHA Trained High school diploma or GED

Hiring Philosophy
All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here.
Who We Are
As a Koch Engineered Solutions company, Optimized Process Designs (OPD) provides clients with detailed engineering packages in all disciplines, single-point procurement for all equipment and materials, fabrication and direct-hired construction services throughout the United States. We leverage in-house capabilities and provide services with faster speed to market to help deliver increased cost savings while minimizing risk.
At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.
Our Benefits
Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.
Equal Opportunities
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: http://www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

title: Software Automation Developer - Future Availability
description:
Job Description
About the Position
This position involves working directly with customers to develop customized processes using ActivityHD’s automation interface. This includes automating processes entirely within ActivityHD as well as developing interfaces with third-party products and services, often via their web APIs. Valuable skills include:
Willingness and ability to work directly with customers to help them improve operational processes. Enjoys learning details of software features in order to help customers make fullest use of them. Enjoys the challenge of solving difficult problems even when doing so sometimes requires working alone to find answers. We have an awesome, supportive team, but sometimes you must persevere and dig out the answers on your own!Effective, professional communication skills whether working with teammates, customers, or other third parties. Familiarity with JScript. Familiarity with Crystal Reports, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or other web-focused tools would be a plus. A working knowledge of accounting principles would also be helpful. 
About AccountingWare
For over 40 years, AccountingWare has been developing accounting software. During this time our customer base has grown to include organizations across a diverse spectrum of industries. Our ActivityHD product includes general ledger, payables, receivables, fixed assets, purchasing, bank reconciliation, and payroll.
Tasks & Responsibilities
What would your work be like? A typical day could include:
Designing and coding custom solutions to create automation bots and third-party interfaces. Collaborating with members of the support and implementation teams to help each other overcome roadblocks. Participating in Agile processes: daily stand-up meetings, sprint-review meetings, and participating with product teams. Troubleshooting with members of our support and implementation teams to understand and resolve customer issues. 
Interested?
If so, we are looking for people who will enjoy and enrich our company culture. These individuals exhibit character traits such as:
You are a person of integrity. Our customers think of AccountingWare as their business partner, so anyone who joins our team must be conscientious, honest, and trustworthy. You love to develop software. On the best of days, programming feels like play more than it feels like work. You are tenacious. Even on the rare days when programming feels more like work, you are willing to dig deep to solve the problem. You are a self-starter. If you happen to have some down time while at work, you naturally use it to explore, learn, discover, and share fresh ideas. You enjoy being a member of a team. Sure, you like to go off on your own and work on a difficult problem, but you also like to be part of a group that accomplishes great things together, and you have interpersonal skills to communicate with team members and customers respectfully and productively. 
If you like what you see here, please Apply Now. We'll look forward to hearing from you!
Company Description
AccountingWare is one of a successful family of technology companies that has been in business for more than 45 years. During this time our customer base has grown to include organizations across a diverse spectrum of industries. Our ActivityHD product consists of multiple modules including general ledger, payables, receivables, fixed assets, purchasing, bank reconciliation, and payroll.
Our office is in Lubbock, Texas, with about 140 employees in four related companies. We are a service driven, strategically agile, customer-focused team characterized by high personal values, self-initiative, extraordinary resourcefulness and a love of all things related to computing and accounting.
AccountingWare is one of a successful family of technology companies that has been in business for more than 45 years. During this time our customer base has grown to include organizations across a diverse spectrum of industries. Our ActivityHD product consists of multiple modules including general ledger, payables, receivables, fixed assets, purchasing, bank reconciliation, and payroll. Our office is in Lubbock, Texas, with about 140 employees in four related companies. We are a service driven, strategically agile, customer-focused team characterized by high personal values, self-initiative, extraordinary resourcefulness and a love of all things related to computing and accounting.
company_about:
AccountingWare is the developer of ActivityHD, a flexible and comprehensive ERP system allowing the sophisticated accounting department to manage the enterprise. ActivityHD includes ActivGL, ActivAP, ActivPO, ActivAR, ActivBR, ActivPR, and ActivFA.

Using the technology developed for ActivityHD, AccountingWare created ActivReporter. ActivReporter is a reporting and data analysis solution for the Microsoft Dynamics GP community. It provides Excel-based financial reporting capabilities with a responsive, on-screen Trial Balance for an incredible view into general ledger data that is not possible with other reporting tools.

company_about:
Federal Advisory Partners provides a broad array of consultative services to both public and private sector organizations. Working collaboratively with our clients, Federal Advisory Partners solves critical management problems and implements sustainable transformational initiatives to achieve organizational success. Our team utilizes best practices and subject matter expertise to customize and execute feasible solutions across all engagements and projects. Furthermore, we are extremely proud of our reputation for exceptional client service and enjoy long-lasting relationships with our clients (many of which dating date back more than a decade) due to the value we provide.


OUR APPROACH:

Federal Advisory Partners’ “high-touch, high-value” approach reflects our dedication to deliver excellence and client service. Our engagement methodology provides a rigorous yet agile framework rooted in industry-leading practices and consistently yields meaningful outcomes delivered on time, and under budget. In addition, our techniques are the products of experiential learning; developed and honed through decades of working collaboratively with our clients in iterative processes of practice, not academic exercises based solely in theory. Finally, our senior leadership is deeply engaged in each and every project, contributing their broad industry expertise and decades of experience to solving our client’s most challenging business problems.

Job Title: WordPress Designer / Developer
Department: Web Production
Reports to: Web Manager
OMG National, a 33-year old marketing and advertising firm and five-year Inc. 5000 recipient, is seeking a qualified WordPress Designer / Developer. This is a key position that will responsible for design and development of a large quantity of website projects from start to completion. The Designer / Developer will have the ability to work on a wide range of clients throughout many different industries. This is a critical position as we look to add to our web department of elite designers and developers. A successful candidate must demonstrate a solid understanding of both website and mobile site design, must be able to show examples of their previous work, and must have experience in designing websites based on the WordPress platform.
Essential Duties And Responsibilities
 Design modern, visually appealing, creative websites within WordPress.  Develop and customize elements on new and existing WordPress websites.  Manipulate a comprehensive library of WordPress themes and plugins given the project specifications.  Troubleshoot advance PHP, MySQL, and CSS issues related to WordPress websites.  Produce custom website / mobile site layouts and execute revisions to them in a rapid and accurate manner.  Be extremely organized in communicating with internal Project Managers, following detailed instructions, and working within out proprietary CRM, effectively and efficiently. 
Qualifications
 Minimum of an Associate's Degree, preferably in Graphic Design, or like-minded computer related field.  Advanced proficiency in HTML, CSS, WordPress, PHP, Illustrator or Photoshop.  3+ years of graphic website / mobile site design experience.  Portfolio of at least five completed / published WordPress websites. 
Work Environment + Headquarters
OMG National's office is a creative environment featuring an eclectic staff of individuals in a business casual atmosphere. Our company is housed is headquartered in Davie, Florida but we have employees working from home / remote across the country!
Compensation + Hiring 
This is a full-time position with a competitive starting wage. Interested applicants should respond to this posting. Please do not call. If an applicant has previously applied to a similar position, we would still encourage the applicant to submit their application.
Hiring Process Overview: Due to the expected large volume of applicants, qualified individuals (as determined by their submitted resumes) will be asked to submit 3-5 WordPress websites that reflect their best design / development work. From there, we will have several rounds of interviews as we narrow the field to our final candidates. We are looking to will the position ASAP.
Company Description
OMG National is a leading Internet Marketing Solutions Company for small and medium-sized businesses. For 33 years, OMG has served thousands of clients, helping them to get and keep more customers. Utilizing powerful products and a results-focused team of digital specialists, we work closely with our clients to achieve their marketing goals. Change is constant in the internet marketing space, but what remains the same, is OMG’s commitment to providing the highest level of client service. The OMG team includes more than 100 members who are passionate about internet marketing, trained in the latest techniques and focused on delivering value, so our clients can concentrate on running their businesses instead of worrying about what Google’s latest ranking changes mean to their businesses.

title: Engineer, Web
description:
Company Description
Tamr, the leader in data products, enables customers to consolidate messy source data into clean, curated, analytics-ready datasets. Organizations benefit from Tamr, the industry’s first suite of data products that combine human curation, patented machine learning, mastering rules and enrichment with first- and third-party data to accelerate business outcomes and deliver business-changing insights. Tamr’s cloud-native and SaaS solutions enable industry leaders such as Toyota, Western Union and GSK to get ahead and stay ahead in a rapidly changing competitor environment.
As we grow our engineering team, we are seeking outstanding, product-minded engineers interested in building products that offer high performance with an elegant interface. This is an opportunity to build enterprise software that solves the most time-consuming, manually intensive problem in data science and modern data pipelines: enriching, curating, and preparing data.
Tamr’s products provide simple but powerful interfaces for data teams to develop and operate complex data pipelines with ease. As a web engineer, you will build and own components of Tamr’s SaaS application front-end.
You will:
Create interfaces that delight users and tame complex problemsShip production code to users dailyGather metrics, analyze, and optimize the user experience to drive key outcomesWork closely with stakeholders to understand customer problems and design innovative solutionsContinuously improve Tamr’s front-end stack and UI architecture

In brief, you will work with a small team of exceptional colleagues to design, build, and deliver next-generation solutions.
Basic requirements:
1+ years experience designing, building, delivering, and supporting production softwareComfort quickly picking up new languages and technologiesBrilliant problem-solving skillsStrong computer science fundamentalsOutstanding ability to communicate technical ideas, both to other engineers and to non-technical stakeholdersOutstanding ability to engage stakeholders to understand and discover their real problems and requirements

You might be a good fit if you have some of the below:
1+ year(s) shipping and supporting SaaS products1+ year(s) of Typescript/React experienceKnowledge of and experience with elm1+ year(s) building and maintaining CI/CD automation1+ year(s) creating production-worthy AI/ML models and pipelinesHands on experience turning problems into solutions from design through delivery

Technologies we use:
Java, Kotlin, Python, Typescript, elmProtobufs and gRPCSpark, Bigtable, BigQuery, PostgreSQLTerraform, Kubernetes/Helm, JenkinsOpen AI, Vertex AI

This position is available in Cambridge, MA, San Francisco, CA, or remote in the United States. Tamr does sponsor employees requiring a visa.
Tamr provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
The ideal candidate is independently minded, self-motivated, and has the experience and breadth of technical knowledge necessary to bring clarity to poorly defined problems and to find unexpected solutions. We are looking for product sense and an entrepreneurial spirit. We believe in simple, beautiful, high quality software. If you care about the end-to-end development lifecycle and ownership of software products—from design and coding through build, test, QA, deployment, management, maintenance, support, and end-user experience—then this role is for you.
company_about: Tamr, the leader in data products, enables customers to use data product templates to consolidate messy source data into clean, curated, analytics-ready datasets. Organizations benefit from Tamr, the industry’s first suite of data product templates that combine human curation, patented machine learning, mastering rules and enrichment with first- and third-party data to accelerate business outcomes and deliver business-changing insights. Tamr’s cloud-native and SaaS solutions enable industry leaders such as Toyota, Western Union and GSK to get ahead and stay ahead in a rapidly changing competitor environment.

A powerful cloud solution, JobDiva combines a CRM, synchronization with all major job boards and VMS providers, BI analytics, a Mobile App and the largest resume database in the world to deliver staffing solutions with unmatched speed and precision. JobDiva offers more patent-protected features than any other solution on the market - including the unique ability to search resumes for "skills by years of experience."​ Continually recognized by both industry experts and clients, JobDiva has received numerous technology as well as staffing industry awards. For more information, visit JobDiva.com. Follow JobDiva on Twitter at @DivaDude.

description:

Key Responsibilities:Provide lifecycle support of applications and ensure compliance of baseline policies and procedures and data standards and governance.Possess a broad knowledge of platforms and operating systems, programming languages, software system design, and requirements analysis.Prepare comprehensive test plans for codebases and recommend corrections, resolve challenges with software, and respond to suggestions for improvement and enhancements.Execute performance monitoring, incident and problem management, change and configuration management, and service level performance for projects.Revise existing data and information systems and procedures to correct deficiencies and maintain more effective data handling, conversion, input/output requirements, and storage, among others.Provide application support, including: Responding to technical inquiries; Software rationalization and lifecycle management; Performing routine monitoring, tuning, and audits of data and information systems; Application maintenance and troubleshooting; Coordinate and implement application patches, upgrades, and configuration changes; Business continuity, disaster recovery planning and testing, and configuration documentation; Analyze data and information systems and audit logs and identify potential issues.Maintain all code using Git and Github, and create and maintain technical and user documentation for all developed applications.Utilize Agile Development in cooperation with team members, and participate in daily Scrum and bi-weekly Sprint close/open.Work in concurrence with the IT Security Officer (ITSO) to maintain and implement security requirements.Contribute to/and maintain documentation for a Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) library in the areas of software development for all projects. Required Skills /Education/ Certifications & Qualifications:Minimum of four (4) + years demonstrated experience in application development or a related field; B.S\B.A in Computer Science desired. title: Product Designer
description:
As a Product Designer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the user experience and interface of our platforms. Your main focus will be on the development of the UI designs related to our Employee Portal and Customer Facing UIs such as Menu Management. You will be responsible for gathering requirements from the Products Team and developing a comprehensive design system. This role requires strong collaboration skills as you will work closely with various teams, including UX Research, Engineering, and Marketing to ensure a seamless and consistent user experience across all our products.

This role is 100% remote, full-time

Salary Range - 130K - 150K

Essential Job Function
Gather and define product requirements from the Products Team, ensuring that these requirements are translated into functional and visually compelling design solutions. Lead the development and maintenance of the Design System, creating comprehensive design guidelines, patterns, and libraries. Design and implement the User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) for our Employee Portal and Customer Facing UIs, including Menu Management. Develop the information architecture and UI architecture, ensuring that it aligns with user needs and product requirements. Collaborate with the UX Researcher to conduct user research and usability tests, interpret findings, and translate them into design decisions. Work with the Engineering team to insert tracking codes for UX data, ensuring the collection of valuable user engagement metrics to inform design improvements. Develop user flows and journey maps to outline the path users take through our platforms, identify potential pain points, and propose solutions to enhance the user experience. Collaborate with UX/UI designers to translate user flows and journey maps into detailed wireframes and prototypes, communicating the proposed design solutions clearly to stakeholders. Work closely with the Engineering team to implement designs, ensuring that the final product matches the approved design and meets the defined user needs and product requirements.Collaborate with the Marketing and Products Team to ensure brand and product consistency across all platforms, contributing to the establishment of a coherent visual and interaction language.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.Proven experience as a Product Designer or similar role. Strong portfolio demonstrating your skills and expertise in UI/UX design. Proficiency in design software such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, etc. Experience with design systems and UI/UX best practices. Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain your design decisions clearly. Knowledge of front-end development is a plus. Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Benefits

We offer Medical, Vision, and Dental plans, along with with a variety of other plans.
company_about:
Our Strength In Numbers:

─ 21K+ Live locations
─ 12M+ Transactions per month
─ 200M+ Orders processed to date
─ $5B+ Order value processed
─ 50+ POS Integrations
─ 100+ 3rd Party ordering platform integrations

What We Do:

ItsaCheckmate provides a comprehensive two-way integration solution that not only connects your POS with the evolving on-demand world but also equips you with powerful monitoring and reporting tools to drive maximum revenue, profitability, and efficiency.

Whether you are an independent restaurant or a global chain, expect the industry’s fastest onboarding and query resolution times. We’ll focus on the backend while you focus on guest experiences!

To enable rapid deployment and customization at scale, we have deep-rooted partnerships with over 150 point-of-sale (POS) and third-party marketplaces (delivery platforms) including DoorDash, Uber Eats, Grubhub, ASAP, EZcater, & ChowNow.

ItsaCheckmate proudly serves true “mom-and-pops” to major global brands like Wendy’s, Arby’s, Sonic, and Buffalo Wild Wings. Our aim is to make technology readily accessible and affordable for restaurants of all sizes.

title: Part Time Bagger PM w/ WE
description:
Job Title Bagger
FLSA Status Hourly 
Reports To Guest Services Manager
The Bagger is responsible for maintaining outstanding customer service as per Company standards, bagging groceries, and safeguarding company assets. Must provide prompt, friendly, reliable service to our customers by using proper bagging techniques and by offering accurate location of item information.
Guest Services Associates have an opportunity to treat every customer as a guest by creating meaningful and genuine interactions; you’ll see our regular guests choosing their checkout lane based on their favorite cashier, not the line length!
Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Ensure that each customer receives outstanding service by providing a friendly environment, which includes greeting and acknowledging every customer, maintaining outstanding standards, solid product knowledge and all other aspects of customer service.Bags groceries, according to bagging procedures.Replaces cleaning and packing supplies used at checkout area(s), maintaining an orderly appearance.Be friendly, courteous, cooperative, and able to communicate with associates and customers.Responsible for maintaining standards according to the Guest Services expectations.Performs prompt parcel pick-up service.Communicate customer requests to management.Support and execute superior customer service.Perform other duties as assigned.Ensure all quality standards are being met, including quantity expectations at 100% by 10 am and 5 pm.Regular, timely attendance in compliance with the work schedule, and adequate notice to find a replacement for occasional absences.
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Ability to bag efficiently while maintaining product integrityAbility to communicate with associates and customersAbility to read, count, and write accuratelyAbility to operate all equipment necessary to perform the job
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT 
The physical demands and work environment described below are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
The associate must possess the ability to stand in place for long periods of time; walk in the store; bend, stoop and lift or push 15-20 pounds on a regular basis and 50 pounds intermittently. Requires fine finger and broad manual dexterity, and eye-hand-foot coordination in order to operate equipment. Ability to work varied hours/days, including nights, weekends, and holidays, as needed in all weather conditions
WORK SCHEDULE
The Bagger is an hourly position. The work schedule may include mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends, and holidays within the individual’s availability.
Festival Foods serves guests in 40 full-service, state-of-the-art supermarkets throughout Wisconsin. At Festival Foods, we're not simply selling groceries, we're on a mission! Every business decision we make is based on our "Boomerang Principle"--empowering our associates to make decisions and take actions that will "Bring the Customer Back". We are proud to be a family and employee-owned company.
At Festival Foods we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all. We are dedicated to building a top-notch team of skilled, experienced and service-oriented associates who represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents. Festival Foods believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates, products, and our community strengthen our ability to serve our guests, as we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people.
Front End

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Job Description
As a Lead Developer at Apposite Technologies, you will work on our world leading network emulation product line. IT managers and engineers rely on our network emulation solutions to measure the performance of a variety of networks, such as private, public or cloud environments, and their components. Users can validate the proper performance and quality of applications, network architectures, and network devices prior to deployment.
Founded in 2005, Apposite Technologies is well-established and profitable technology company based in Los Angeles. We are growing our R&D team and launching new products to support enterprise and government cloud adoption. Our customer base consists of over 2,500 enterprise, government, and development companies.
Responsibilities:
Develop and manage software connecting front end UI and API to back end server. Develop automation scripts for regression testing and optimize usabilitySupport product release process

Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or Computer ScienceJavascript/Nodejs developerExperience with NPMExperience with XML, JSON and YAMLAdditional experience with unit test frameworks is a plus. Experience with test automation, Google Cloud, Azure, Amazon Web Services or any other public/private cloud environment would be idealBasic understanding of TCP/IP networking
Candidates must be authorized to work in the USA. Apposite Technologies is an Equal Opportunity employer
No relocation assistance. Local candidates preferred.***
company_about:
Apposite Technologies is the leader in easy-to-use, enterprise-class network simulation products. Apposite’s Linktropy and Netropy WAN emulation appliances simulate link bandwidth, delay, loss, congestion, and other network impairments to test the performance of applications in the lab under a spectrum of real-world conditions. 

Offering a unique combination of ease-of-use, test lab-level precision, and unmatched pricing, Linktropy and Netropy WAN emulators are widely deployed by leading enterprises, application and equipment developers, telecoms carriers, test labs, and government and military organizations across the world.

title: Python Developer
description:
Python Developer

Full-time/Remote

Responsibilities

As a Python Developer, you will be a key member of our collaborative team supporting our federal client. You will work cross-functionally in an Agile environment to develop an application using Python with a focus on the Django framework.

Must be able to understand data ingests in an AWS Cloud environment. Create public RESTful APIs. Work with backend and frontend code. Mentor peers and other developers in Python/Django design and development techniques. Participate in stand-ups, design/requirements meetings, code reviews, and internal technology sessions. Provide ideas for innovation in development, performance improvements, process improvement, and testing. Work independently on development of code and creation of unit tests.

Must be flexible, able to work in a highly collaborative environment, juggle multiple tasks at once, and work independently and collaboratively as needed. Must have superior interpersonal skills and strong communication skills.

To be successful, a candidate should have the following skillset: 
5+ years of solid Python and Django development experienceExperience with ETL processes to ingest, transform and save content obtained from multiple data sourcesExperience with data workflows and data pipelinesExcellent communication skillsExperience with JSON-based APIsExperience with MicroservicesExperience with JavaScript and JQueryExperience with Enterprise Search engines, such as Solr or ElasticsearchAgile Development (Scrum) experienceExperience with developing and deploying to the AWS CloudExperience creating CI/CD pipelines for deployment

Other Requirements The right candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or other related scientific or technical discipline. The nature of being a federal contractor is that the client gets to regulate a few aspects:The person for this role must be authorized to work in the United States; preferably a US Citizen or Permanent Resident per our Federal client requirement. This person must also be able to pass a Public Trust background check/clearance required by the Federal client.This position is open to US-based candidates only; candidates must reside in one of the following states: Washington, D.C., Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Texas, North Carolina, Georgia, Rhode Island, Tennessee, or Florida. The role will require a pre-employment background and credit check in addition to any applicable client clearance.
Our Company + Your Future

Artemis Consulting is an IT Services and Management company that supports a variety of government agencies in their goals of providing transparency and in making their services easier to access using leading-edge and open-source technologies. In supporting their digital transformation journeys, our collaborative teams are focus on creating modern applications through the use of innovative technologies and methods. We are a growing company looking for motivated individuals who are focused on career growth and adding value to our team. We believe in diversity, equity, inclusion, work-life balance, and offer competitive salaries with comprehensive benefits. If you’re passionate about bettering our world through the development of systems in support of government agency missions, we would love to have you join our Artemis team!

Remote Life

You will be empowered to propose ideas and improve products supporting our government clients’ missions, all while working from home.

Artemis Consulting is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified candidates will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to disability, race, color, religious creed, national origin, sexual orientation/gender identity, or age.

We utilize DevSecOps, along with microservices, for scalability, security and reliability. Artemis performs Agile Scrum, KanBan and SAFe development for its clients. title: Front-End Supervisor
description:
From $15.82 - $16.61
Position Title: Front End Supervisor
Department: Sales
Supervisor: Branch Manager
FLSA: Non-exempt
Position Summary
Supervises Cashiers, Front-End Loaders, Checkers and U-Boat Retrieval.
Essential Functions
 Supervises, trains and evaluates cashiers, front-end loaders, checkers and U-boat retrieval. Ensures friendly, efficient and professional customer service. Ensures compliance with established sales and security policies and procedures. Investigates and resolves customer complaints in a timely and professional manner. Assists customers with product location and detailed information when needed. Plan and prepare work schedules to include lunch and vacation. Performs cashier "check-outs" and operates register, when needed. Performs Supervisor functions of voids and returns, price adjustments, IOUs (F-6) vs. invoicing and cancels transactions. Assists checkers in comparing customer receipts to items on cart to avoid losses. Efficiently uses industry specific software to resolve customer inquiries, price checks, inventory queries and price discrepancies.
Other Responsibilities
 Performs other work-related duties as required and assigned.
Education, Experience And Skills Required
 Bachelor's Degree, OR High School Diploma of GED with at least 4 years experience in customer service or related field, OR Any appropriate combination of education and experience. Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, and technical procedures. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, clients, and general public Ability to calculate figures, and amounts such as discounts, interest, proportions, percentages, area, mass and volume. Effective oral and written communication skills. High level of interpersonal skills to handle sensitive situations. Commitment to company values and strong customer orientation. Computer Literacy
Physical Requirements
 Lift/Carry Abilities (measured for maximum or average load) Lift - 50 lbs Carry strength (50' or less) - 50 lbs Frequent lift/carry (> 12x/hour) - 50 lbs Constant lift/carry (> 30x/hr) - 20 lbs Physical Aptitudes (rated based on level of skill involved) Agility/dynamic balance 80-119% Finger dexterity - 80-100% Manual dexterity - 80 - 100% Posture Tolerance (rated based on frequency or time involved) Stand/walk - constantly Reach above shoulder level - occasionally Twist/turn head - occasionally Bend over/stoop - occasionally Climb steps/ladder - occasionally Kneel/squat - occasionally
Work Environment
 For the most part the ambient will be room temperature, due to proximity of work-station to the exit doors, room temperature may change according to the season and the level of activity at the store.
Acknowledgement
I fully understand the responsibilities and qualifications required for this job. Furthermore, I find that I am capable of performing the required functions.
