title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER
description:
Req #: 224410

Department: COLLEGE OF EDUCATION

Posting Date: 07/05/2023

Closing Info: Open Until Filled

Salary: $7,554 - $ 12,276 per month

Shift: First Shift

Notes: As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For a complete description of our benefits for this position, please visit our website, click here. (https://hr.uw.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2018/02/benefits-professional-staff-librarians-academic-staff-20230119_a11y.pdf)


POSITION PURPOSE


The University of Washington (UW) is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoy outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.

Cultivate Learning fosters the quality that makes access to learning meaningful. Backed by the University of Washington, our research-powered innovations and hands-on partnership create a fertile environment for smarter teaching and learning. We advance opportunity by lowering barriers to entering the profession and guiding educators to success. And we identify the building blocks of quality along with the path to use them – in Washington State and across the country. Every child deserves to flourish from a foundation of quality learning. This core belief drives our work to provide talented learning professionals the support they need to build that foundation. At Cultivate Learning, we translate insight into learning opportunity.

At Cultivate Learning, we are champions of service and align with partners and initiatives that foster positive outcomes for children, families, and educators. We commit to equity by working to remove systemic oppression and institutional racism, so each community member can reach their full potential. We build environments of belonging and diversity where we communicate openly, support each other, and value the contributions of all identities. We practice innovation and quality by actively seeking creative ideas from multiple perspectives to evolve and inform the resources we develop.

Cultivate Learning has an exciting opportunity for a Lead Product Software Engineer who will lead the application development team focused on the Coaching Companion, an online learning platform and mobile app that powers professional development for the early childhood education field. Coaches and educators use Coaching Companion to connect to a community of professionals, access evidence-based learning resources and receive support to improve quality practices with children and families.

The position, reporting to the Deputy Director, will also serve as a Senior Director on the Cultivate Learning Director’s Group, a team that manages and supports the center’s teams and units. The Lead Product Software Engineer will provide strategic oversight and development of a family of digital products called the Coaching Companion. There are three custom versions of the Coaching Companion including a Head Start version that was developed for the Office of Head Start to support online coaching; the Campus Edition developed for online instruction of higher education courses; and CECI, the Coach and Educator Community Interface, a customizable state solution. This position will lead a team of developers who will be responsible for the development and maintenance of the Coaching Companion products. The role will be responsible for team management, monitoring, reporting and proper and timely project execution. Successful candidates will be able to prioritize, communicate clearly, work across multiple facets of the projects and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time. Candidates must have experience as a product engineer and must be familiar with the entire product development cycle as well as possess current knowledge of technological advancements to implement during the engineering phase. The position works closely with senior management and program teams to define requirements and take the lead on operational and technical projects to build high-quality solutions that align with partner needs and center goals. This position requires strong analytic capability coupled with a passion for creating innovative solutions to support educators who work with children and families.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 Software, Architecture & Implementation: (50%)
Lead the design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of Coaching Companion features.Be responsible for the development of a high-level plan for the family of Coaching Companion products as well as each specific platform, working with the program leads and other stakeholders to define software requirements as part of an agile development process.Make software architecture decisions based on agreed operational requirements, providing justifications for decisions with documented evidence. This includes producing specifications and determining operational feasibility.Be the recognized technical expert on the development of the coding for this project and its implementation.Responsible for ensuring that the family of products are well-designed with testable and efficient code.Use best practice in software development including test driven development, continuous integration, and continuous improvements based on user research.Plan and execute a product roadmap that continuously improves the product's stability, security, performance, and maintainability while satisfying customer requirements and meeting specific deadlines driven by grants and contracts.Support teams to execute tests and debug web and mobile applications across multiple browsers and mobile devices, respond to and resolve issue reports as well as implement user feedback.Identify team and stakeholder challenges/needs and create functional prototypes to offer a solution.Coordinate prototype submissions with responsible program teams for approval.Keep thorough and ordered documentation on all software development.Ensure that the code is accessible, allowing for future adaptations, modifications and reviews of the code.Ensure that the family of Coaching Companion products are implemented with high standards for data security and privacy.Work within privacy guidelines at the University of Washington to maintain the security of the site according to recommendations and requirements.Work with current tech stack, which includes: PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, React Native.Experience with Git and AWS preferred. Coordination and Business Analysis: (25%)Develop and expand the functionality of the existing Coaching Companion family of products using feedback and collaborations with internal program team and executive leadership to consider current and future requirements.Develop creative ideas and share them with colleagues, seeking their views and implementing innovative changes based on feedback.Work in partnership with the Community Engaged Research and Evaluation team to coordinate the data that is collected within Coaching Companion to support various evaluation projects.Participate in the requirements gathering and various project planning stages which include gathering requirements from program teams, coordinating work with outside vendors, and periodically meeting with stakeholders, such as the Washington State Department of Children Youth and Families, Institutes of Higher Education, Head Start, and others to communicate project status and ensure that projects move forward towards completion.Support the understanding of the Coaching Companion family of products among stakeholders and identify priority areas in line with project requirements.Support connection and integration with other technology solutions such as state registry systems and other systems of record to ensure that user progress in Coaching Companion is connected to broader state early learning systems.Maintain current knowledge of competing products and brands, analyze market and industry trends and conditions, and oversee the scale of successful Coaching Companion prototypes. Team Management: (25%)Manage a team of developers and testers for the family of Coaching Companion products and ensure that all team members are familiar with and implementCultivate Learning’s core values to drive more equitable workforce solutions.Provide guidance and support to others in developing their software engineering skills.Establish protocols and policies to uphold deliverables in state, federal and private contracts, and grants. This includes adherence to turn-around times, accountability for the quality of the product, plans for risk mitigation and accountability for the security of the site.Be an active member of the Cultivate Learning Director’s Group including participation in meetings, representing the work and needs of teams implementing digital solutions and act as a thought partner for strategic planning efforts at the center.Communicate center-wide information to the unit and ensure that team members participate in all-team events and meetings.Complete recruitment and hiring processes in partnership with the Deputy Director and College of Education Human Resources team.Support on-boarding for new team members and ensure that all center policies are understood and adhered to by team members.Other duties as assigned MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or a related field, to include 4-5 years of relevant work experience. Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration. ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTSExperience with agile development methods and making architecture decisions to build secure software systems.Ability to design, build and manage large systems, especially ones with sensitive data.Demonstrable experience in a leading a team in developing web and mobile applications.Proficiency developing web services including:- Modern Javascript frameworks- Scalable databases- Server programming- Experience programming using an object oriented language, such as PHP or Python.- Experience working with SQL or NoSQL databases.- Strong web development skills and demonstrated proficiency using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.- Familiarity with Git or other version control system.Expertise in cloud architecture including:- AWS, Azure or GCP- Serverless architecture- Practical application at scale e.g. costs, monitoringCapability to research and implement integrations with outside web services.Knowledge and experience implementing a software development life cycle from preliminary system analysis to tests and deployment.Experience with project management within a software engineering setting.Demonstrated ability to work with and communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff with a wide range of computer/technology/media skills and knowledge.Ability to take initiative, set priorities, handle multiple projects, and exercise good judgment in a fast paced, dynamic and deadline-driven environment in an organized and professional manner.Ability to think strategically, problem solve, and suggest creative solutions.Have excellent presentation, oral and written communication skills and have experience working with different stakeholders, at different levels within a process.Ability to work well and collaboratively within a diverse team environment interacting with individuals at all levels within Cultivate Learning.Previous supervisory experience and team management preferred.Familiarity with web accessibility standards, including Section 508 compliance. DESIRED QUALIFICATIONSBe reflective, responsive professionals committed to personal and professional development and be willing to engage in learning and development relevant to the role.Be committed to the values of Cultivate Learning including diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging and be able to connect the technical vision and work of the team to the greater mission of the center.Experience in early care and education, youth development, higher education and/or non-profit, community-engaged work preferred but not required. Application Process: The application process may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment, you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, sex, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
company_about:
Founded in 1861, the University of Washington is one of the oldest state-supported institutions of higher education on the West Coast and is one of the preeminent research universities in the world. Located minutes from downtown Seattle, the main UW campus provides gorgeous views of the Cascade and Olympic mountain ranges and, every spring, attracts visitors from all over to world who come to witness the blooming of its cherry blossom trees.

As the state’s flagship university, the UW serves more students than any other institution in the Northwest. In addition to its Seattle campus, the University has thriving campuses in Tacoma and Bothell and a robust professional and continuing education program. 

Anyone can enjoy and be enriched by all the UW has to offer, including world-class libraries, art, music, drama, sports and the highest quality medical care in Washington state.

Being public also means being engaged with our communities, and through knowledge and discovery we are elevating the quality of lives of others.

title: Product Designer
description:
As a Product Designer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the user experience and interface of our platforms. Your main focus will be on the development of the UI designs related to our Employee Portal and Customer Facing UIs such as Menu Management. You will be responsible for gathering requirements from the Products Team and developing a comprehensive design system. This role requires strong collaboration skills as you will work closely with various teams, including UX Research, Engineering, and Marketing to ensure a seamless and consistent user experience across all our products.
This role is 100% remote, full-time
Salary Range - 130K - 150K
Essential Job Function:
Gather and define product requirements from the Products Team, ensuring that these requirements are translated into functional and visually compelling design solutions. Lead the development and maintenance of the Design System, creating comprehensive design guidelines, patterns, and libraries. Design and implement the User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) for our Employee Portal and Customer Facing UIs, including Menu Management. Develop the information architecture and UI architecture, ensuring that it aligns with user needs and product requirements. Collaborate with the UX Researcher to conduct user research and usability tests, interpret findings, and translate them into design decisions. Work with the Engineering team to insert tracking codes for UX data, ensuring the collection of valuable user engagement metrics to inform design improvements. Develop user flows and journey maps to outline the path users take through our platforms, identify potential pain points, and propose solutions to enhance the user experience. Collaborate with UX/UI designers to translate user flows and journey maps into detailed wireframes and prototypes, communicating the proposed design solutions clearly to stakeholders. Work closely with the Engineering team to implement designs, ensuring that the final product matches the approved design and meets the defined user needs and product requirementsCollaborate with the Marketing and Products Team to ensure brand and product consistency across all platforms, contributing to the establishment of a coherent visual and interaction language
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related fieldProven experience as a Product Designer or similar role. Strong portfolio demonstrating your skills and expertise in UI/UX design. Proficiency in design software such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, etc. Experience with design systems and UI/UX best practices. Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain your design decisions clearly. title: Research Engineer
description:
About The Opportunity
The College of Social Sciences and Humanities (CSSH) is a leader in the Experiential Liberal Arts. The College is strongly committed to fostering excellence through diversity and enthusiastically welcomes applications from members of groups underrepresented in higher education administration.
The College’s schools, departments, and programs—with disciplines ranging from economics and history to English, urban affairs, international affairs, and American Sign Language Interpreting—form an interdisciplinary environment with global perspectives and a culture of inclusion. Our faculty connects liberal arts education with the challenges of our time, fostering ethical reasoning and critical thought with attention to the enduring significance of history, literature, and culture. Strategic Areas of Focus for the College’s education and research throughout its global network are (1) Resilience, Sustainability, Health, and Equity, (2) Cultural Transformations, Governance, and Globalization, and (3) Network Science, Computational Social Science, Digital Humanities, and Information Ethics.
CSSH has long been committed to creating a culture of inclusion for our students, faculty, and staff. Diversity and inclusion, as well as questions of race, racism, and anti-racism, are part of all our programs, all our research centers, and our three areas of strategic focus—and are always works in progress. At the same time, we focus on how modes of constructing social hierarchies, including race, gender, sexuality, class, ability, and others, intersect with one another.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this role is to serve as a programmer and system administrator for the National Internet Observatory (NIO). The successful candidate will work on the National Internet Observatory (NIO) to design, deploy, and maintain the lifecycle of research computing infrastructure. This includes designing and deploying in-house cloud computing infrastructure, selection and deployment of new hardware, ongoing maintenance of physical systems, managing user authentication services, routinely applying operating system updates, supporting for devops workflows, and database administration. The successful candidate will work closely with the NIO software development teams as well as support external research partners. It is anticipated that most tasks will be using Linux machines following established Infrastructure as Code (IaC) processes.
This is a one-year, full-time, benefits-eligible position with the option of renewal based on performance and available funding.
Qualifications
Education: BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering or an equivalent field.
Skills: Multi-year experience as a programmer and/or system administrator, ideally with a focus on Linux/UNIX systems, is required. Experience with front-end web services (Django and similar technologies), database administration, high performance computing, container platforms (Docker), and container orchestration (Kubernetes) is a plus. The ability to prioritize and manage concurrent projects is a necessity. Experience with Configuration Management Tools such as Puppet and Foreman preferred.
Documents To Submit
Resume and cover letter required.
Position Type
Research
Additional Information
Northeastern University considers factors such as candidate work experience, education and skills when extending an offer.
Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness & life, retirement- as well as commuting & transportation. Visit https://hr.northeastern.edu/benefits/ for more information.
Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.
All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see www.northeastern.edu/diversity.
company_about: Founded in 1898, Northeastern is a global research university with a distinctive, experience-driven  approach to education and discovery. The university is a leader in experiential learning, powered by the world’s most far-reaching cooperative education program. We integrate classroom study with opportunities for professional work, research, service, and global learning in more than 100 countries. The same spirit of collaboration guides a use-inspired research enterprise focused on solving global challenges in health, security, and sustainability. Northeastern offers a comprehensive array of undergraduate and graduate programs leading to degrees through the doctorate in nine colleges and schools, and select graduate programs at campuses in Boston, Charlotte, N.C., San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle, and Toronto. Campuses in Burlington, MA, and Nahant, MA, are home to research institutes for homeland security and coastal sustainability, respectively.

title: React Native Front-End Developer
description:

Data Management: Manage data flow between the mobile application and Salesforce, implementing mechanisms for data validation, synchronization, and error handling to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Performance Optimization: Identify performance bottlenecks in the application and optimize code, API calls, and data caching to deliver a smooth and responsive user experience. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to translate requirements into technical specifications and deliver high-quality solutions. Documentation: Document the codebase, API integrations, and technical decisions to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding for other team members. Troubleshooting and Bug Fixing: Investigate and resolve issues related to the mobile application's UI, functionality, and Salesforce integration, collaborating with cross-functional teams as necessary. Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in React Native development, Salesforce integration, and mobile application development in general.

 Proven experience developing mobile applications using React Native, with a strong portfolio of relevant projects. title: Full-Stack Web Developer
description:
At Mancomm, We Exist to Organize Laws and Regulations for Easy Understanding and:
 We expect integrity, energy, and urgency We expect follow through of other persons' understanding. (Every person you communicate with, peers, customers, vendors, etc.) We expect that our processes are clearly documented and understandable. (You are following, and updating, the instructions for the task.) We expect everything to be world-class. (It is aesthetically pleasing, correct, and what is necessary.) We expect to deliver much more than we take. (Your focus is on the enrichment of the other person from your deliverable.)
Mancomm is a highly creative company that is great with clients, and is the most dominant company in our niche. There are thousands of satisfied Mancomm customers and millions of employees all over the country whose workplace conditions have been dramatically improved because they are able to clearly understand the laws and regulations affecting them.
New Laws and Regulations are being written every day, and we need to make them clear and understandable. A very noble, exciting, and challenging job that makes real differences in peoples lives through our software.
Good software makes life fun and enjoyable! 
Mancomm is seeking a creative Full Stack Web Developer that can work with our software application team to achieve our business’ digital goals. The ideal candidate for this position is a hands-on professional with strong knowledge of content management platforms, and an ability to translate our business needs into client-friendly functions that will expand our website’s influence in our industry.
The Full Stack Web Developer will be responsible for updating our current online applications, as well as developing and implementing a usability testing process to ensure that new website applications meet our company’s requirements.
Requirements
Our current Stack is:
.net ASP MVCSQL ServerAjaxjQueryJavaScriptBootstrapWe are looking to implement new technologies, like MEAN, or MERN to build our future with
Full Stack Web Developer Tasks
Offer an interesting, simple and functional siteUpdate existing applications to meet the security and functionality standards as outlined in the company’s website policiesImplement testing tools that monitor the ongoing performance of the company websiteAssist in updating application development policies to ensure that all future applications meet the latest technical requirements
Full Stack Web Developer Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field (Master’s preferred)2+ years’ experience in application development and testing1+ years’ SDLC implementation experienceAbility to create support documentation for all new applicationsStrong teamwork skillsProven knowledge of the most current security and web development programming languages
Benefits
401(k) with company dollar for dollar match (up to 4% of your gross)Personal Health Savings Account, yours to keepHealth, Dental, and Vision InsurancePaid Time Off and Holiday Pay
MANCOMM develops hundreds of state-of-the-art regulatory products, including training tools, reference guides, and resources that will enable members of every business or organization to become compliant with the most recent regulations outlined by state or federal governments. We also offer a variety of Spanish training and reference products to accommodate everyone in the classroom or worksite.
company_about:
MANCOMM, a safety and compliance publisher, provides business and industry with state-of-the-art regulatory products, training tools and resources.

Our books and CDs of regulations are made with RegLogic®, a unique graphical approach which takes the difficulty out of navigating and understanding this complex information.

Regulations covered by these products come from the Department of Labor/Occupational Safety and Health Administration, California OSHA, and the Department of Transportation. MANCOMM regulatory products and training programs, including the OSHA Essentials of Safety 10- and 30-hour card course training materials and Forklift Training Systems, serve General Industry as well as Construction.

Your feedback is always welcome, for it is an integral part of our product development process. MANCOMM keeps in touch with your needs and develops new products to provide solutions for your safety and compliance challenges. Product research is ongoing and regulatory products are updated regularly.

title: Digital Designer (User Experience & User Interface)
description:
SymSoft is a design and technology company looking for a Digital Designer (UX / UI) to join our fast-growing design team in North Natomas — one of the most convenient Sacramento neighborhoods right here in the heart of California.
Your skills in delivering compelling visual designs will contribute to our award-winning digital solutions. You will work with high-profile organizations to improve how they deliver content and provide services to end customers.
This is a fulltime onsite position.
What You’ll Do
Design digital interfaces, with a focus on information and interactions for enterprise and government organizations that have a lasting impact on the end customers.
Bring design to life. We value all types of visual and interactive prototyping. Work with the team to communicate design ideas to the stakeholders in the most efficient fashion.
Contribute to important decisions about the way our websites and products look, feel, and interact. Establish standards for the visual design quality and present best-practices to the project team and your peers.
Understand and advocate for the customer. Work with UX researchers (or conduct your own research) from initial customer discovery through to visual attitude and usability testing.
Design with accessibility and inclusion in mind. Understand WCAG 2.1 and Section 508 accessibility guidelines and recommendations.
Grow. Further develop your skills, and learn how to take ownership of important aspects of the design beyond structural and surface design.
Collaborate. Work with a team whose diversity of approaches brings variety to your ideas and design solutions. Utilize different team members’ skills to deliver the best results.
Deliver. Use a progressive enhancement approach and prioritize the must-have over the nice-to-have assets and features.
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Strong understanding of the elements of visual design — typography, photography, color and layout.
Experience collaborating with and presenting to cross-functional teams with different backgrounds.
Awareness of how design patterns and front-end frameworks affect the design process. Every design decision will influence the final design system and technical implementation.
A responsive design approach that favors proportions over pixels and multi-resolution environments.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Desire to contribute to meaningful projects.
A good sense of humor.
To be considered for this role, please submit a resume and portfolio with examples of process and evolution of work (not only the final results).
At SymSoft, you will be surrounded by peers who are committed to helping each other grow through collaboration and ongoing feedback. If you’re looking to grow your career and improve your skills working on some of the largest projects in California that serve millions of customers, this is the right place for you.
Requirements
BA / BS in a design-related field, or comparable work experience.
3–5 years of experience as a digital designer.
Advanced skills in Adobe Creative Suite and / or similar visual design software.
Skilled in using prototyping tools (Adobe XD, InVision, Figma)
Bonus Skill: Basic understanding of HTML5, CSS3 and Accessibility Standards.
Benefits
Competitive salary and benefits, including health / dental plan, paid time off and holidays.
Complimentary snacks, soft drinks, tea and coffee.
High-profile projects that will get attention and an opportunity to build your personal brand.
Salary Range: $70,000/ Year to $100,000/Year. (Depends on experience and Negotiable)
company_about:
SymSoft is a digital agency specializing in user experience (UX) design, accessibility compliance, data-driven personalization, business intelligence and enterprise applications. We focus on helping clients in regulated industries use digital platforms such as Sitecore and Adobe Experience Manager to deliver best-in-class customer experiences. We empower business users to publish their own content and optimize the customer experience using analytics and data. Our client list spans multiple industries including Financial Services, Energy, Health Care, Government and the Trades. We believe creating remarkable digital experiences requires a combination of industry knowledge, human-centered service design, distinctive visual appeal, personalization driven by what we know about the customer from all past interactions and rapid transaction response times on their chosen device. We maintain the skills to cover these areas in-house and deliver them in a “best value” studio model that maximizes our customer’s return on IT investment.

Our full suite of services includes:
•	Customer Experience
•	Content Strategy
•	Data-driven Personalization
•	Responsive Web Design
•	Content Management Systems
•	Business Intelligence Solutions
•	Location Intelligence Solutions
•	Web and Mobile Applications
•	Section 508 Compliance
•	Software Development
•	Systems Integration
•	Managed Services
•	Business Process Design

title: Marketing Web Developer
description:
Who We Are
Kinsley Construction is a full-service construction company that is committed to doing right by our people, right by our roots and right by you. Operating throughout the Mid-Atlantic Region, we serve clients in a variety of industries. From Building, Civil and Industrial construction, we do what it takes to get the job done and done right. If you want to leave your mark, take pride in what you do each day and create something that you can show off to your family - then join ours.
Summary Of Position
Kinsley Construction is seeking an experienced Web Developer who can balance artistic creativity with practical business needs for our growing Marketing team in York, PA. The ideal candidate must have a positive attitude, be professional, and willing to wear a hard hat and construction boots when needs. The Web Developer will report directly to the Senior Marketing Manager and will be responsible for the overall experience visitors have on our website platforms and for managing and enhancing all SEO activities.
The Marketing Department supports all of the company’s divisions and primary objective is to assist with marketing communications and fulfill the marketing needs of our internal customers. We document our employees and projects to create genuine corporate communications, and our creative team produces content for both internal and external audiences, ensuring that the brand's visual identity is maintained and developed.
We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including Medical/Dental/Vision, Short/Long Term Disability, Life Insurance, 401K Plan with company match and paid PTO/holidays.
Qualified applicants may apply on our website at https://careers.kinsleyconstruction.com/ or mail, fax or email resume including salary requirement to:
KINSLEY CONSTRUCTION, INC.
PO BOX 2886
YORK PA 17405
717-815-6909 (Fax)
careers@kinsleyconstruction.com
WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
FEMALES, MINORITIES, VETERANS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY
Typical Responsibilities / Essential Functions
 Pull reports and discover trends using Google Analytics Monitor and improve SEO results Ensure websites meet accessibility standards and all federal and state standards Create online forms, keyword rich content, meta descriptions, page titles and content pages Develop a plan to ensure all pages are regularly reviewed and updated Collaborate with the Marketing team to update blog posts Understand and stay abreast of current digital trends and best practices, and proactively identifies new web ideas Perform other duties as assigned to support the Marketing Department
Experience & Education
 Must be ambitious self-starter and team player who is driven to meet deadlines and is self-motivated Minimum of 3 years of experience in web development, specifically with WordPress, HTML, CSS, PHP, and JavaScript Strong understanding of responsive design principles and experience creating websites that provide a seamless user experience across various devices and platforms Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work well with other marketing team members and independently Experience leading a large multi-site redesign projects Broad knowledge of web design, programming, web content development, digital publishing, email and web-based communications best practices, technologies and tools Experience designing websites to meet institutional requirements and federal accessibility standards and cross-browser compatibility Reliable in-person attendance is required
company_about:
Kinsley Construction is a full-service construction management and general contracting firm that operates in the mid-Atlantic region of the US. 

We deliver projects on time and on budget, with no surprises. Our collaborative project approach sets the standard for communication with our customers to provide client-driven solutions and satisfaction.

We pride ourselves on being very flexible and reacting quickly to customer needs as well as market demands. We are a service organization whose mission is to provide efficient solutions to our customers’ challenges.

title: Front-End Department Head
description:
Company Name: Kroger Stores
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Position Summary
Create an outstanding customer experience through exceptional service. Establish and maintain a safe and clean environment that encourages our customers to return. Drive the department in reaching sales and profit goals established for the department, and monitor all established quality assurance standards. Direct and supervise all functions, duties and activities for the Front-end department. Responsible for the execution of best practices, goals and Front-end standards established for the department. Embrace the Customer 1 st strategy and encourage associates to deliver excellent customer service. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of others.
Essential Job Functions
 Promote trust and respect among associates, with a positive attitude.  Communicate company, department, and job specific information to associates.  Collaborate with associates and promote teamwork to help achieve company/store goals.  Create an environment that enables customers to feel welcome, important and appreciated by gaining and maintaining knowledge of product sold throughout the store to be able respond to questions and make suggestions about products.  Monitor and control supply expenses for the department.  Manage cash control, sales and cash items and records for the store.  Manage the scheduling of Front-End associates to provide adequate department coverage.  Assist store management in preparing the store/department budget, profit and loss reviews, and take appropriate action on all financial reports.  Develop and implement a department business plan to achieve desired results.  Create and execute sales promotions in partnership with store management.  Implement the period promotional plan for the department.  Stay current with present, future, seasonal and special ads.  Monitor and control expenses for the department.  Schedule daily, weekly and monthly price changes by updating shelf tags and promotional signs.  Plan and organize the inventory process, maintain awareness of inventory/stocking conditions, note any discrepancies.  Train department associates on inventory/stocking and Computer Assisted Ordering.  Reinforce safety programs by complying with safety procedures, identifying unsafe conditions, practicing preventive maintenance by properly inspecting equipment, notifying appropriate store management of any items in need of repair and of customer or employee accidents.  Report all safety risks or issues, and illegal activity, including: robbery, theft or fraud.  Oversee and manage the efficient operations of all functions and activities of the Front-End.  Adhere to all local, state and federal laws, food safety regulations and company guidelines.  Coach and train Front-End associates on the performance of their duties; assist with performance reviews and provide feedback.  Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation.  Minimum Position Qualifications:
 Must be 18 or older  Effective communication skills  Knowledge of basic math (counting, addition, subtraction)  Ability to handle stressful situations  Retail or Customer Service experience  Front-End experience  Desired Previous Job Experience
 High school education or equivalent preferred  Assistant Customer Service Manager  Management experience  Second language (speaking, reading and/or writing) 
Education Level:None
Required Certifications/Licenses:None
Position Type:Full-Time
Shift(s):Day; Evening
 Regions : Mid-Atlantic
States : Virginia
Keywords
Jobs at Kroger: At Kroger, we hire people who have a passion for helping others and who want to build a relationship with our Customers. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Kroger. We look for people who want more, aspire to be more and work hard to achieve their goals. Our focus on keeping the Customer first is what makes us successful. We offer many opportunities not only in our stores, but in Manufacturing, Logistics, Marketing, Finance, Human Resources, and many other fields.
Company Overview:  Kroger Family of Companies employs nearly half a million associates who serve over 11 million customers daily through a seamless shopping experience under a variety of  banner names  . At The Kroger Co., we are Fresh for Everyone™ and dedicated to our Purpose: To Feed the Human Spirit®. We are committed to creating #ZeroHungerZeroWaste communities by 2025. Careers with The Kroger Co. and our family of companies offer competitive wages, flexible schedules, benefits and room for advancement.
Posting Notes: VA || Chester || 10800 Iron Bridge Rd || 23831 || Kroger Stores || [[mfield2]] || Customer Service; Store Operations || Employee || Non-Exempt || Full-Time || None
company_about:
At Kroger, we believe no matter who you are or how you like to shop, everyone deserves affordable, easy-to-enjoy, fresh food. This idea is embodied in our simple tagline—Fresh for Everyone™.  

Kroger ranks as one of the world’s largest retailers. We are nearly half a million associates across 2,800 stores in 35 states operating two dozen grocery retail brands and 34 manufacturing and 44 distribution locations, all dedicated to living our Purpose: to Feed the Human Spirit™. Together, we serve more than 11 million customers daily in our stores and online through convenient e-commerce options like pickup, ship and delivery, serving America through food inspiration and uplift. 

Customers love Our Brands, including the popular Kroger®, Private Selection® and Simple Truth® brands. Our own manufacturing plants produce many of Our Brands products, including breads, dairy products, meat and thousands of grocery items. 

We also believe in and are committed to doing our part to create #ZeroHungerZeroWaste communities by 2025. 

To learn more about us or apply for a job, visit TheKrogerCo.com.

title: Full Stack (React) Developer
description:
Job Description
Summary: Celero Commerce is looking for a Full Stack (React) Developer to join our team developing a net-new cloud-native TypeScript application to serve our internal teams and business partners. Our mission is to deliver simple-to-use, bundled electronic payments solutions that enable efficient, sustainable growth for small to mid-sized businesses.
The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for working with a cross-functional team to design, implement, and maintain the entire application stack, from the back-end (API/GraphQL Schema) through the front-end (ReactJS). The ideal candidate has strong communication/collaboration skills, and the desire to learn new things, try new technology, and seek opportunities to grow.
Job Requirements:
Be a key contributor to the development of a full-stack TypeScript applicationAssist with creating the application front-end using ReactJS, building reusable componentsImplement the data abstraction layer using GraphQL and SQLAuthor unit tests using Jest, ensuring acceptable code coverageLeverage Storybook for component designWork with project management and key business partners to create and groom user storiesTranslate designs and wireframes into clean, scalable, and secure high-quality code, meeting functional requirements and architectural directionConduct peer-reviews of code for standard pull request activityDevelop software documentation for developed source codeAid in technical support of production systems
Qualifications
4+ years web development3+ years ReactJS development - thorough understanding of React and its core principlesStrong proficiency in JavaScript and moderate to extensive experience with TypeScriptStrong experience developing APIsExperience with CSS and supporting frameworksDemonstrated aptitude at creating practical unit testsSolid experience in SQL Server developmentUnderstanding of web application debugging, including for security and performanceUnderstanding and use of DevOps as part of the development processBachelor’s degree in computer engineering, or related education/experienceSelf-motivated with a strong work ethic with the ability to prioritize, work with multiple teams, and deliver efficiently
Education:
High School Diploma required; Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science related field preferred
Celero will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this role. 
This role is Remote and available to candidates located in Arkansas, California, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Kentucky, South Carolina, Tennessee, or Texas.
This job description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of duties or standards of the position. Additional tasks may be assigned and the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands. Applicants are advised that false statements or omission of information on any application materials may be grounds for non-selection, withdrawal of an offer of employment, or dismissal after being employed. 
Celero Commerce provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
Company Description
Celero Commerce offers payment processing services, business management software, and data intelligence to small and medium-sized businesses, in one holistic platform. Celero empowers business owners and executives to focus on driving growth and profitability.
We are committed to providing our employees a work environment that cultivates excellence in which partners, customers, and team members are valued. We hold ourselves and our team to a high standard, including an unwavering commitment to teamwork, professionalism, dedication, integrity, achievement, and ownership of duties. We believe that these commitments will improve our ability to deliver excellence to our customers.
Visit our website to learn more at https://www.celerocommerce.com/.

title: GBDS Data Analyst
description:
Become a member of LM’s Global Business Development & Strategy (GBDS) Transformation team! If you are interested in transforming the process, data, and technology that are used to instrument the front-end of the business and optimize the opportunity lifecycle then this is the opportunity for you.
To help GBDS on this journey we are looking for a qualified candidate for the position of the GBDS Data Analyst working to achieve the GBDS transformation vision of an insight-rich function where team members of all levels have access to data and information that is fit for use at the speed of relevance.
Primary Responsibilities Include
 Execute high-priority strategic data analytics projects based on GBDS leadership priorities Become a recognized expert on GBDS core and common data for opportunity, customer, and competitor. Support the GBDS Tools Portfolio with by ideating analytics and AI capabilities to be built in GBDS’s opportunity management, customer relationship management, capture management, proposal management, and competitive intelligence capabilities
This is a rotational position supporting the 1LMX GBDS Transformation Program. This position is expected to be a 2–3-year assignment and upon conclusion of rotation the successful candidate would need to compete for another position outside the program.

title: Front End Clerk
description:
Company Name: Kroger Stores
Position Type: Employee
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Position Summary
Create an outstanding customer experience through exceptional service. Establish and maintain a safe and clean environment that encourages our customers to return. Embrace the Customer 1 st strategy and encourage associates to deliver excellent customer service. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety of others.
Essential Job Functions Minimum Position Qualifications: Desired Previous Job Experience
 Promote trust and respect among associates. Create an environment that enables customers to feel welcome, important and appreciated by answering questions regarding products sold within the department and throughout the store.  Gain and maintain knowledge of products sold within the department and be able to respond to questions and make suggestions about products.  Responsible for being visible and actively greeting, engaging and assisting customers.  Process customer transactions through the check lane quickly, accurately, and efficiently. Understand the Point of Sale (POS) system, and handle various tenders such as Cash, Checks, Credit, Debit, SNAP EBT, Offline SNAP EBT, WIC, Rain checks, complex loyalty offers, coupons and checkout procedures according to company policy.  Understand and adhere to the company's limits on cash shortages and/or overages and work honestly and effectively to control loss.  Understand and adhere to guidelines on restricted sale items (Alcohol, Tobacco, Fireworks, Videos, etc.)  Collaborate with Front-end associates to encourage teamwork.  Report pricing discrepancies to the Scan Coordinator.  Report product ordering/shipping discrepancies to the department manager.  Display a positive attitude.  Stay current with present, future, seasonal and special ads.  Adhere to all food safety regulations and guidelines.  Ensure proper temperatures in cases and coolers are maintained and temperature logs are maintained.  Reinforce safety programs by complying with safety procedures and identify unsafe conditions and notify store management.  Practice preventive maintenance by properly inspecting equipment and notify appropriate department or store manager of any items in need of repair.  Notify management of customer or employee accidents.  Report all safety risks or issues, and illegal activity, including: robbery, theft or fraud.  Adhere to all local, state and federal laws, and company guidelines.  Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation.  Ability to handle stressful situations  Effective communication skills  Knowledge of basic math (counting, addition, and subtraction)  Customer service experience  Courtesy Clerk 
Education Level:None
Required Certifications/Licenses:None
Position Type:Part-Time
Shift(s):Day; Evening
 Regions : Midwest
States : Ohio
Keywords
Jobs at Kroger: At Kroger, we hire people who have a passion for helping others and who want to build a relationship with our Customers. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Kroger. We look for people who want more, aspire to be more and work hard to achieve their goals. Our focus on keeping the Customer first is what makes us successful. We offer many opportunities not only in our stores, but in Manufacturing, Logistics, Marketing, Finance, Human Resources, and many other fields.
Company Overview:  Kroger Family of Companies employs nearly half a million associates who serve over 11 million customers daily through a seamless shopping experience under a variety of  banner names  . At The Kroger Co., we are Fresh for Everyone™ and dedicated to our Purpose: To Feed the Human Spirit®. We are committed to creating #ZeroHungerZeroWaste communities by 2025. Careers with The Kroger Co. and our family of companies offer competitive wages, flexible schedules, benefits and room for advancement.
Posting Notes: OH || Piqua || 1510 Covington Ave || 45356 || Kroger Stores || [[mfield2]] || Customer Service; Store Operations || Employee || Non-Exempt || Part-Time || None
company_about:
At Kroger, we believe no matter who you are or how you like to shop, everyone deserves affordable, easy-to-enjoy, fresh food. This idea is embodied in our simple tagline—Fresh for Everyone™.  

Kroger ranks as one of the world’s largest retailers. We are nearly half a million associates across 2,800 stores in 35 states operating two dozen grocery retail brands and 34 manufacturing and 44 distribution locations, all dedicated to living our Purpose: to Feed the Human Spirit™. Together, we serve more than 11 million customers daily in our stores and online through convenient e-commerce options like pickup, ship and delivery, serving America through food inspiration and uplift. 

Customers love Our Brands, including the popular Kroger®, Private Selection® and Simple Truth® brands. Our own manufacturing plants produce many of Our Brands products, including breads, dairy products, meat and thousands of grocery items. 

We also believe in and are committed to doing our part to create #ZeroHungerZeroWaste communities by 2025. 

To learn more about us or apply for a job, visit TheKrogerCo.com.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
This Job Is For You If You
Are a front-end developer with required experience working with web standards, JavaScript, and angular js Have an intellectual curiosity to pursue the unknown, to continuously improve, and ambition to grow in a fast-paced environment. Have the ability to think like a customer (see not their own, but the user’s perspective) Have the ability to communicate well with peers, cross-functional groups and international customers (excellent spoken and written English language skills)
Responsibilities
Ability to effectively communicate project solutions, process improvements, new trends, and technologies [and more] to executive leaders. Responsible for the effective communication of the proposed solutions to a client during the solution development phase of a project Ability to collaborate with various internal teams (PMO, Creative, Delivery, Managed Services, Client Success), and 3rd party vendors) Ability to deliver multiple medium-complexity projects or a large highly complex program. Creates technical specifications, low-level design documents, code and unit test plans and strategies for the entire project Leads development activities for the entire project(s) including writing high-quality code, helping team members meet coding and quality standards Interpret business requirements and/or functional specifications, and write technical documents including low-level design documents and technical specifications Identifies risks, creates mitigation strategies and plans, and executes them in a timely manner, keeps all stakeholders and the project manager informed about the progress, as well as escalates to the right levels at the right times (ensuring zero surprises) Communicates with all levels of the organization, internal, cross-functional, and external, and keeps customers/stakeholders up to date on project development status. Monitor the work done by her/his team members, mentor them to reach the next level, and is accountable for team deliverables Identify reusable code segments from the project deliverables and help build internal code libraries, and productize libraries. Good understanding of Kensium’s implementation and project management tools; Jira, Clarizen, Bitbucket, Confluence, Git Lab Good understanding of Frontend technologies and able to deliver eCommerce (Magento and Bigcommerce) projects from a technical aspect. 
Experience And Skills

Minimum
9-10 Years of experience as a developer and strong knowledge in various designing tools and techniques CSS and HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, angular JS, React Js Photo shop, Dream weaver, Flash, and Illustrator. Hands-on experience working with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript libraries and their practical uses in building complex interactive experiences. Experience in building websites in Magento 2. x Frontend Development Deep knowledge of Customization of Magento Themes as per requirements. Knowledge in node JS, VueJS and ReactJS with Redux for Remix. NextJS (and or) NuxtJS Should have worked on Headless Commerce and built commerce applications Experience in GraphQl APIs and its implementation in Magento 2 PWA Studio & Vue storefront / BigCommerce Storefront. Good understanding of Frontend technologies and able to deliver eCommerce (Magento and Bigcommerce) projects from a technical aspect. Follow best coding practices, theme setup, customizations, integrations with parties, connectors, and backend systems. Should be strong in Written/communication skills 
Preferred
Magento JS Certification, General understanding of BigCommerce FE. 
Minimum Qualifications
Candidate should have BE/BTech/MCA or BFA/MFA or have equivalent experience
company_about:
We are a full-service ecommerce solutions provider specializing in designing, developing, and integrating Magento and BigCommerce websites. We use the latest insights to tailor your web store for increased conversion rates and the likelihood of repeat customers. 

We also offer implementation, integration, and customization services for Acumatica ERP and Acumatica Commerce Edition, a complete eCommerce package for merchants looking to integrate Acumatica to Magento or BigCommerce. 

Additional offerings include technical SEO, PPC campaigns, and ongoing support services for Acumatica, BigCommerce, and Magento.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
The UX/UI Designer will design experiences that help our partners understand our business process and achieve customer success. Our partners are vital to our growth as we partner with more than 50 Point of Sale (POS) and 100 ordering platform partners. You’re an exceptional designer and a great communicator. You’re a team player, partnering with product managers, growth and partnership team, engineers, operational leads, and our design team, to ensure our partners feel ecstatic working with us.

This role is 100% remote, full-time.

Salary Range - 90K - 100K

Essential Job Functions
Owning the end-to-end user experience and design strategy for all our partner personas Inventing and evolving new visual and interaction designs based on experience, requirements, brand guidelines, and user needs Create user-focused designs (mockups, prototypes), informed by feedback, requirements, and your user research Collaborating with other designers, growth and partner managers, product managers, operation leads, and technologists Advocating for design excellence, craftsmanship, and usability in all aspects of the onboarding experience Primarily responsible for developing UI designs related to Onboarding UI and AR products
Requirements
3+ years of experience working with internal tools, such as CRMs.Distinguished portfolio of modern and progressive UI architecture, interaction and visual designs Proficiency using contemporary design tools to solve complex problems and communicate in visually stunning detail - we use Illustrator, Photoshop, and Figma. Experience measuring and testing your designs against business metrics and analyzing user experience flows for improved partner success BA or MA/MS Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Web Design, or related field or work experience as a designerKnowledge with CSS, HTML, Javascript, and frontend frameworks (i.e. React) A personal love of what we’re building
Benefits

We offer Medical, Vision, and Dental plans, along with with a variety of other plans.
company_about:
Our Strength In Numbers:

─ 21K+ Live locations
─ 12M+ Transactions per month
─ 200M+ Orders processed to date
─ $5B+ Order value processed
─ 50+ POS Integrations
─ 100+ 3rd Party ordering platform integrations

What We Do:

ItsaCheckmate provides a comprehensive two-way integration solution that not only connects your POS with the evolving on-demand world but also equips you with powerful monitoring and reporting tools to drive maximum revenue, profitability, and efficiency.

Whether you are an independent restaurant or a global chain, expect the industry’s fastest onboarding and query resolution times. We’ll focus on the backend while you focus on guest experiences!

To enable rapid deployment and customization at scale, we have deep-rooted partnerships with over 150 point-of-sale (POS) and third-party marketplaces (delivery platforms) including DoorDash, Uber Eats, Grubhub, ASAP, EZcater, & ChowNow.

ItsaCheckmate proudly serves true “mom-and-pops” to major global brands like Wendy’s, Arby’s, Sonic, and Buffalo Wild Wings. Our aim is to make technology readily accessible and affordable for restaurants of all sizes.
